loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es joyero  y vive  en casa propia en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento, en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento de su familia.
Rogelio  requiere el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción: comprara ladrillos, cemento, fierros  para construir el muro de su casa y de esta manera mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia como también la seguridad.
El sueño de Rogelio es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a jeweler and lives in his own brick home with a cement floor, in the area of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz. He works for more than eight hours a day as he is the sole breadwinner of his family.

Rogelio needs a loan in order to buy construction supplies: to buy bricks, cement, and iron rods for the walls of his house and thus improve the quality of life for his family as well as the security.

Rogelio’s dream is to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and iron rods in order to construct the walls of his house for better security

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 43-year-old responsible housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, two daughters and two sons. Her husband is working in a wood shop. He has a very low salary, and it is very difficult for them to manage the household expenses; they are facing many problems in life. 

Since 2001, Zubaida has been running a small general store to generate a second source of income for her family. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. She wants to buy a variety of goods like milk, sugar, rice, soap, detergent, creams etc. She wants to introduce some new items in her general store in order to fulfill the increasing demands of customers and to increase her savings. 

Zubaida would reinvest the profit amount in her general store and a part of it to pay her household expenses and for the education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her general store.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is 53, a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamkuu has been operating a fish and coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other fish sellers for business.

With KES 30,000 that she is borrowing from Kiva, Mwanamkuu wants to dig a borehole (water well) that will enable her to establish another business selling water.

loans.use: to dig a borehole that will enable her establish another business selling water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products like flour, cooking oil, salt, and vegetables to make empanadas.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer joven de 27 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completada,Madre soltera de 2 hijos con casa propia y día a día se esfuerza para tener un mejor bienestar para ella y su familia. Ella se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas como ser: papa y rábano ya que dicha experiencia la adquirió desde muy joven actividad inculcada por sus padres a los que ella en su juventud les ayudaba a sembrar maíz y frijol. El terreno que ella tiene es propio y esta ubicado a 100 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación ya que lo adquirió por medio de sus padres gracias a una herencia que ellos mismos le obsequiaron. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por los compradores que llegan a la zona y demás que viven al rededor de su casa de hogar. Ella se esfuerza y trabaja duro para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro, un mejor estilo de vida y no pasen por la situación tan difícil que ella en su juventud paso.

Actualmente maría solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la compra de semilla certificada de papa, rábano y abono para poder sembrar y cultivar.

Su meta es poder tener una producción de provecho que le genere lo estimado para poder seguir cultivando y poder cumplir sus sueños de formar un capital propio para poder seguir invirtiendo en su cultivo ya que de esa manera ella podrá asegurar el futuro de sus hijos con un mejor bienestar y dando la oportunidad de estudiar para que ellos se puedan graduar a nivel universitario.
texts.en:
María is a tenacious young woman aged 27. She has completed primary school and she is a single mother of 2. She lives in her own house and she strives on a daily basis to grant a better standard of living to her family and to herself. She engages in agriculture, planting vegetables such as potatoes and radish. She has gained a considerable experience while working with her parents, something she has been doing since she was very young, helping them planting corn and beans. She owns some land located at about 100 meters (0,06 mi) from her house, and she inherited it form her parents. She sells her products to buyers coming to her area as well as to her neighbors. She makes efforts and she works very hard in order to grant a better future and a better standard of living to her children, so that they will not have to go through the difficult situations she has had to live when she was young.
María is currently requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of potato and radish certified seeds, as well as manure to keep on planting and growing her crops.
Her goal is to succeed in having a profitable production that provides her with enough money to keep on planting and to help her achieve her dream of putting together a working capital of her own in order to keep on investing in her crops; this is how she plans on succeeding in granting a better future and comfort to her children, offering them the chance to study and to attend and complete university.

loans.use: To buy potato and radish certified seed as well as manure.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a 24-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Talibon, in Bohol in the Philippines. Maureen has worked in pig husbandry for two years, and this is her main source of income. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Maureen is asking for a loan so that she can buy feeds for the pigs, and additional ingredients to cook like vegetables, meat, seasoning and cooking oil. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and her income. In the future, Maureen dreams of making her business more successful. She would like to be able to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy the feeds for the pigs, and additional ingredients to cook like vegetables, meat, seasoning and cooking oil.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Esther from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 year and 17 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2006, Esther established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Esther requires a loan in order to buy more plastic slippers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of the home. 

In the future, Esther plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic slippers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 36 years old. She is married with four children. With the loan, she is planning to buy more bananas and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is taking out another Kiva loan for 20,000 KES. Mwanaisha has diversified her business to selling fish and coconuts. With the loan, Mwanaisha wants to purchase bundles of fish and coconuts for resale. She gives thanks to Kiva lenders and Yehu for the opportunity given to her as it has improved her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Pamela Edith

texts.es: La Sra. Pamela tiene 23 años,  casada con 1 hijos que varón de 7 años, la Sra. Pamela se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en su tienda que se encuentra en una zona céntrica d la ciudad de El Alto este préstamo es el segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Pamela va a usar este préstamo para la  compra de ropa por mayor por el cambio de temporada y así abastecerse de nueva mercadería para surtir su tienda, la Sra. Pamela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la ubicación de su tienda a pesar que es  céntrica en la ciudad de el alto pero a su vez peligrosa ya en inmediaciones de la misma se encuentran muchos bares, además de tener mucha competencia por la zona necesita constantemente renovar mercadería y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir la tienda y ahorrar y poder Abrir otra tienda ya que este es su sueño y así poder expandirse y crecer con su negocio, además de expandirse a la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Pamela is 23 years old, married with one child, a seven year old boy. Pamela works selling new clothing in her store that is located in a central area of the city of El Alto. This is her second loan sequence with the institution.

Pamela is going to use this loan to buy wholesale clothing for the changing season and thus to stock up on new merchandise to stock her store.

Pamela faces challenges in her business which are the location of her store  even though it is in a central part of El Alto it is dangerous at the same time as there are many bars in the vicinity, and besides that there is a lot of competition in the area so she needs to constantly renew merchandise. She is going to use the loan proceeds to buy more merchandise to supply her store and for savings to be able to open another store as this is her dream so she can expand and grow with her business, also expanding to the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the change of seasons

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Adelfa works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Adelfa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Adelfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Fatmata from Western rural area. She is single and is trying to generate a permanent source of income since she did not go to school.

Fatmata runs an egg business within her environment; she sells eggs and fish. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business every day, moving around selling eggs and fish. . She says that her business is doing well because out of the profit she is able to take care of herself and her mother. 

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more fish and eggs. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future, she plans to change her business to a palm oil and 'gari' (cassava couscous) seller. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish and eggs.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en: Rubi is a 35-year-old responsible housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and one child. Her husband is a laborer and he has a very low monthly income. Rubi has been doing a business selling hair dryers for two years. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new variety of hair dryers to increase her sales. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase hair dryers to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 21. She sells construction materials. She is married to a technician and they don’t have a child yet. With the loan, she would like to buy more lamps and wires to use in electricity installation. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more lamps and wires for sale.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 33 years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past nine years. Since she started this business, she has progressed in all corners of the life. She has requested the loan to buy more trousers, coats and sweaters. She is planning to use the profits to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more trousers, coats and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking out another Kiva loan of Kshs 15,000.  With the loan, she wants to diversify by investing in her farming business. With the loan, Maria plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.  She is thankful for the Kiva lenders and Yehu for the opportunity given as it has improved her family's living standards

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Carmen Sara

texts.es: Doña Carmen viven en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, Carmen es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frijoles, maiz,azucar, frutas, golosinas, entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación con las ganacaias que obtiene de susu ventas liogra cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Doña Carmen solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Carmen lives with her husband and children in a house that she owns. Carmen is a very responsible and hard-working woman who has succeeded in getting her family ahead. She owns a store that sells foodstuffs such as bread, refreshments, cooking oil, vegetables, beans, corn, sugar, fruit and snacks, among other items. Her business is located in her home and with the profits she makes from her sales she's able to afford her household expenses. Carmen requests a loan which will allow her to stock up her store so that she can better serve her customers. That way she'll increase her sales, which is a priority for her as it will bring progress to her household.

loans.use: to purchase essential grains, snacks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lanie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lanie is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to restock her store of food and household goods like snack foods, sugar, milk, soap, and shampoo.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and pig-raising business.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store of food and household goods like snack foods, sugar, milk, soap and shampoo

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruits in the Philippines. He is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in his stall. He has been in this business for twenty years. He also earns income from a vulcanizing shop.

Rolando has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. He dreams of saving money to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in his stall.

loans.name: Joelyn

texts.en:
Joelyn is 35 years old, married with four children, three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Joelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Joelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Joelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Joelyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

Virginia has been in this business for three years. Virginia earns more income from raising pigs.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 51 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Alicia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 50 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Felisa has a business selling buko juice (coconut water) in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of coconuts for making buko juice.

Felisa has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconuts for making buko juice.

loans.name: Ma. Isabelita

texts.en:
Ma. Isabelita is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods. 

Ma. Isabelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her jeepney.

Ma. Isabelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her jeepney.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Allan is engaged in food vending business in the Philippines. Allan requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for food vending.

Allan has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Allan would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jesus Marisela

texts.es:
La  Señora  Jesús Marisela de 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos  en su casa de habitación ubicada en San Lorenzo , en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 04 años a la venta comida como ser, pollo, filete de camarón, carne asadas y abarrotería en general. 
Doña Jesús Marisela su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, donde a diario le visitan sus amigos y personas que transitan  para comprarle sus productos.
Doña Jesús Marisela está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más pescado, carne, tomates, cebollas, chiles verdes, aguacates, plátanos, salsas, especias, cubitos etc. ya que su clientela ha aumentado y le están pidiendo  diversidad de platillos de comida.
Doña Jesús Marisela espera obtener más ganancias con el apoyo de este préstamo y a la vez mejorar un poco su condición de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Jesús Marisela su sueño es  mejorar su negocio y poner un restaurante, aqui en la foto puede ver a la señora Jesús Maricela atendiendo a sus clientes.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
Jesús Marisela is 31 years old, she lives with her husband and their children in a house of their own in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has been engaging in selling food for 4 years, offering chicken, fish fillets, shrimps, roast meet as well as general products.
Jesús Marisela’s activity is located in her house, where friends and passers-by visit her on a daily basis to buy her products.
Jesús Marisela is requesting a loan to buy more fish, meat, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, avocados, plantains, sauces, spices and ice cubes, as the number of her customers has increased and they are asking for new and different dishes.
Jesús Marisela hopes to earn a better income thanks to this loan, as well as to improve some more her family’s living conditions as well as her own.
Jesús Marisela’s dream is to improve her activity and to open a restaurant. In the picture you can see Jesús Marisela tending to her customers.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – April 2013.

loans.use: To buy fish, meat, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, avocados, plantains, sauces, spices and ice cubes.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman; she has two kids, one of whom attends school. Mbodze owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

Mbodze has operated a motorcycle transport business from door-to-door where passersby and town dwellers are her potential customers. She has a challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate the business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to add to her savings and purchase a new motorcycle. Mbodze joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to add to her savings in order to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
Maseray is 26 years old and married with 1 child, age 2 years. She runs a general store business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells biscuits, sugar, sweets and cigarettes within her neighborhood.  She says that the main challenges to her business are improper business location and price increases.

Maseray requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more biscuits, sugar, sweets and cigarettes. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her capital and pay her installment. In the future, she would like to open a big slipper shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, sugar, sweets and cigarettes.

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es: La Señora Idalia, es casada ahora es madre de 4 hijos, ella imparte clases desde muchos  años en escuela primaria y su esposo  continua desempeñándose como técnico en refrigeración, así ellos buscan como salir adelante con su familia brindándoles lo principal a sus hijos lo que cabe dentro de sus posibilidades ya que ambos tienen empleos con salarios muy bajos. Con el préstamo anterior logro cercar su casa con malla y con el presente crédito le pondrá cerámica a su casa por lo cual se siente agradecida con Kiva y Afodenic, ya que solamente con ayuda de financiamiento es posible hacer estas mejoras de vivienda, para contar con mejores condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en:
Idalia, is married and the mother of four children. She has been teaching in a primary school for many years, and her husband continues working as a refrigeration technician. This is how they are helping their family get ahead in life; by providing their children with the necessities, to the best of their abilities, as both have jobs with very low salaries.

With the previous loan she managed to enclose her house with a chain link fence, and with this loan she will install tile in her house. So she feels grateful to Kiva and Afodenic, as only with the help of the loan is it possible to make these improvements and have better living conditions in her home.

loans.use: To buy tile, cement, sand and other materials.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: Don Jose de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de ropa interior como: camisetas, boxeres, calzoncillos, calcetines, etc con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Jose esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia antes mencionada para surtir su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor vida sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
José, 57, lives in his own house with his wife and his son.  He makes a living selling underwear such as t-shirts, boxers, underpants, socks, etc.  With his sales he's able to cover some of his household expenses.

José's requesting a loan to be able to buy the merchandise indicated to stock his business.  This way he'll get better profits and give his family a better life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy more socks, boxers, etc.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is a 53 year old married woman and a mother of three children, from Getafe, Bohol.  She has been engaged in the farming business for more than 10 years.  This is the source of her income. 

Irenea is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.  With this, she will be able to improve her farm and eventually her harvest.  In the future, Irenea hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 44 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He owns and operates a business buying and selling used shoes in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over six years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional used shoes to sell. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Aladin

texts.en:
Aladin is 39 years old, married, with two children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

To earn a living, he owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been in his business for over three years and he earns PHP 10,000 every month. 

Aladin joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) this year to gain access to financial services, to help improve his business and living situation. And now he has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase spare parts and tires. 

In the future, Aladin wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Rino

texts.en:
Rino is a 29-year-old married man from San Miguel, Bohol. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than 10 years now. Rino is also in rice farming.

Rino is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. Rino hopes to make his business a success and more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a seaweed farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the seaweed-farming business for more than 15 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

 Ma. Glenda is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and fishing nets. Through this, they will be able to improve their businesses and make them a success. Ma. Glenda dreams of experiencing fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and fishing nets

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man and a father of four young children from Talibon, Bohol. He earns a living through his tricycle transportation business. He has been in this business for more than 6 months. This is the source of his income. Samuel is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of hismotorcycle and to buy spare parts like tires, nuts, bolts and fuel. Through this, he will be able to increase his income and provide for the needs of his family, such as food and other things.

loans.use: To pay for the repair of his motorcycle and buy spare parts like tires, nuts, bolts and fuel

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en: Daphrose is 39 years old. She is married with five children. With the loan, she would like to buy more sweet potatoes and sodas to sell in the restaurant she has been running for the past five years. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Susana Beatriz

texts.es: Susana vive en casa propia con su familia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años con las ganancias que realiza de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Susana esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio como cebollas, tomates, sandias, ejotes, papas, piñas, etc. y asi tener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Susana lives with her family in a house that she owns. For the past several years she has owned a business selling fruits and vegetables. With the profits she earns from her sales she's able to afford her household expenses. Susana is requesting a loan which will allow her to purchase more merchandise for her business such as onions, tomatoes, watermelons, green beans, potatoes, pineapples, etc. That way she'll obtain better profits and she'll be able to provide more financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Doña Margarita de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de naranjas en un mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues da a buen precio sus productos y es una persona muy amable, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas naranjas por mayor y asi pueda siempre satisfacer a sus clientes cuando la busques para comprar y ella pueda obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en: Margarita, 55, lives with her husband in her own house.  She has a business selling oranges in a market near her home.  She has a large clientele because her products are well-priced and she’s a very gracious person.  She’s requesting a loan to be able to buy more oranges at wholesale so she can always meet customer demand when they come by to buy and so that she can earn higher profits in order to have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy oranges at wholesale.

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en:
Saveth, a rice cultivator from Thmor Kol district of Battambang province, is 52 years old and a mother of three children. Her two hectares of rice farming land is the main source of her family’s income. She has engaged in rice farming for 30 years and is able to earn up to 39,100 KHR per day.  

This is not the first loan for Saveth with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely used her past loans to support the basic needs of her family, especially sufficient daily food for her children. She has also already repaid her past loan successfully. Now, Saveth is leading a group of three. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 KHR, while her first-time co-borrowers are applying for 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, Saveth will spend her loan portion to pay a plowing fee for her rice farm. She hopes to gain a high yield and keep up good progress on improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee for her rice farm

loans.name: Asliah

texts.en:
This is Asliah, 34, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. Together with her husband Khadaffie, she manages their household and cares for their children while operating the business.She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Asliah operates a retail business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and residents of the local community. She also sells rice. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of different products like shades, watches and other products to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan to buy rice.

Asliah dreams that her business will get bigger, and she hopes to give her children a good life and education. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different products like shades, watches and other products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena; she previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan to buy additional mineral water for her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rowena hopes to expand her business and have a mini grocery. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of water for her business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
This is Christopher, 27, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Maria, an employee, and they have a child. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.  

Christopher operates a food stall. He sells snacks, like burgers, and he is planning to add fruit-shakes of different flavors to his business. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales, every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more burger ingredients and to start a fruit-shake stand.

Christopher hopes that his business will be successful and dreams to always provide for his family. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more burger ingredients and to start a fruit-shake stand.

loans.name: Gloria Liliam

texts.es:
Achuapa, es un bello y encantador municipio, donde existen diferentes tipos de Actividades tantos comerciales como ganadera, es aquí donde habita la joven Gloria Liliam.  

Gloria Liliam se llama el Joven de 41 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, brinda su servicio secretaria en la alcaldía municipal.   

Es Casada no tiene hijo, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, con lo poco que el produce como agricultor aporta parte de la alimentación, de esta forma ayuda al sustento diario, pero es de su gran necesidad llegar a tener un refrigerador, por tal razón le solicita a Kiva Y Ceprodel que se la financie a través de un crédito. 

Son de sus sueños que Kiva Y Ceprodel le financien para lograr su objetivo, ya que es de su conocimiento que ayudan a las personas pobres con deseo de superación.
texts.en:
Achucapa is a beautiful, charming town where a variety of commercial and cattle-raising activities exist; this is where young Gloria Liliam lives.  Gloria Liliam is the name of this 41-year-old young woman who strives for her life and her family; she works as a secretary in city hall.

She’s married and has no children.  Her husband works in agriculture.  He contributes the little he earns as a farmer to pay for part of their food costs thus helping with daily support but her greatest need is to buy a refrigerator which is why she’s asking Kiva and Ceprodel for a loan to finance this purchase.  
Her dream is that Kiva and Ceprodel will finance her in order to reach her objective since it’s her understanding that they help poor people who want to improve their lot in life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer joven, que formó parte de un banco mujer ,siendo presidenta del mismo. Pero al ampliar su negocio y necesitar de un monto mayor , ella decide hacer una solicitud de crédito individual en la fundación.
Es una mujer muy emprendedroa, que busca su crecimiento personal y también apoyar con el presupuesto familiar.
Ella tiene un abastecedor , en el que vende productos de primera necesidad, como abarrotes, latería, carnes, verduras, artículos de librería en la época escolar y también vende comidas rápidas que ella prepara.
  Todos los días  realiza las tareas de la casa y la atención del negocio, ella lo abre desde las 5 y 30 de la mañana y cierra a las 9 pm. 
Sus vecinos son sus clientes quienes le solicitan nuevos productos, ya que el pueblo donde vive está alejado de la cuidad y es difícil para ellos trasladarse a conseguirlos.Motivo por el cual ella solicita a la fundación el préstamo de 600 mil colones, para poder vencer la falta de esos artículos y así contar con un inventario más variado.
Su negocio está ubicado en su casa, pero ella realizó una remodelación para independizarlo completamente de la casa, para mayor comodidad para ella y sus clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia is a young woman who joined a women’s communal bank and is its president.  To expand her business and needing a larger loan amount, she decided to apply to the Fundación for an individual loan.  She’s an enterprising woman who seeks personal growth and also to help support the family budget.

She owns a store where she sells basic staple goods like groceries, canned goods, meats, vegetables, stationery supplies during the school term and also sells fast-food items she prepares herself.  She does these activities every day as well as all her housework.  She opens for business at 5:30 in the morning and closes at 9pm.

Her neighbors are the customers who request new products from her since the town she lives in is far from the city and transportation there is difficult to come by which is why she’s asking for a 600,000 colon loan from the Fundación to buy the things she needs to have a more varied inventory on hand.  Her store is located at home and she carried out a bit of remodeling there in order to make it completely independent from the living quarters for her and her customers’ increased comfort.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, groceries, canned goods and stationery supplies.

loans.name: Milagros Del Rocio

texts.es:
Milagros es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Milagros no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Ceviche de Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Milagros trabaja como vendedora de mostrador en una ferretería de su ciudad, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja en su pequeña tienda donde prepara y vende diversos postres y dulces en su hogar, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Milagros se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de golosinas, abarrotes y bebidas, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder abastecer su tienda y atender a mas clientes, así pues Milagros seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Milagros is a 19-year-old young woman. She's single and lives with her parents and siblings in the town of Chiclayo, district of Guadalupe. She's a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person with a great deal of drive to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and out of the need to work from a very young age, Milagros wasn't able to study for a professional career in business administration as she wished. In her free time she enjoys cooking a delicious duck ceviche for sharing with her family.
On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Milagros works as a counter salesperson in a hardware store of her town. In addition, on weekends she works in her small store located in her home, where she makes and sells a variety of desserts and sweets. She works everyday for about 10 hours and believes that she does well because of her good work and her friendliness towards others.
Milagros is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she'll be able to purchase snacks, groceries and beverages, which will be very useful for her to stock up her store and serve more customers. That way Milagros will continue working and making an effort in order to achieve her biggest dream of owning a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Trabajando Por El Futuro Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Trabajando Por El Futuro” con 10 socios dedicados a distintas actividades comerciales, la cual pasan a su 7 ciclo,  la gran mayoría de ellos  vecinos de la zona. Teresa de 61 años casada y actualmente sigue apoyando a 01 de sus hijos. Ella comenzó con la venta de algunos víveres y golosinas, poco a poco y con la ayuda de  su pareja pudo implementar su negocio, actualmente cuenta con una tienda surtida, siendo sus mayores clientes vecinos de la zona. Se siente feliz pues dicho negocio le ha permitido apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes.   Ver a su hija realizarse profesionalmente es su mayor anhelo, es por ello que se esfuerza. El grupo “Trabajando Por El Futuro” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Teresa es la primera del lado derecho viste chompa roja y polo negro. En la parte superior al lado derecho esta Ada. Martha no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This the “Trabajando Por El Futuro” group, with 10 members working in various businesses. They are starting their seventh loan cycle. The great majority of them are neighbors. Teresa is 61 and married. She is still supporting one of her children. She began by selling some groceries and candy, and little by little with her partner's help, has been able to run her business. Currently she has a well-stocked store, and her best customers are her neighbors. 

She feels happy, as this business has allowed her to support her children with their education. With the aim of continuing to improve, she applied for a loan so that she can buy groceries, drinks and candy. This way she can have goods to offer her customers. To see her daughter become a professional is her greatest wish, and that is why she does her best.

The "Trabajando Por El Futuro" group thanks the people who made this loan possible. Teresa is the first on the right, wearing a red sweater and black T-shirt. In the upper part of the photo, on the right-hand side, is Ada Martha. She wasn't able to be present, due to work reasons.

loans.use: To buy candy, drinks and groceries for her store.

loans.name: María Angelica

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años elabora tortillas; oficio que aprendió de su madre. Antes María solo realizaba los oficios domésticos en su casa. Luego instalo una pequeña tienda y una venta tortillas; pero por circunstancias de la vida lo dejo de hacer. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reactivar la tienda comprando productos de la canasta básica y para instalar nuevamente la venta de tortillas; ambos negocios en su casa.

Ella busca reactivar sus negocios; debido a que necesita otra fuente de ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de su familia, como la salud, educación, alimentación, etc. más aún porque ella es la que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos. Pues, su máximo deseo es que sus hijos sean unos profesionales para que mejoren su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 35, is a single mother of two children. She’s been making tortillas for the last ten years, an occupation she learned from her mother.  María used to just work doing her domestic chores at home but later on installed a small store and started also selling tortillas.  Due to life’s circumstances, she stopped doing so.  The loan she’s asking from Fundación Campo will be used to reactivate the store; she will buy basic staples and also to restart the tortilla sales.  Both businesses will be home-based.

She is seeking to restart her businesses because she needs an additional source of income to cover all her family expenses such as health, schooling, food, etc., even more so because she’s who watches over her children’s well-being.  Her greatest wish is that her children become professionals so they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to reopen the store and also to start selling tortillas again.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es: Doña Nohemi, tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en la Libertad Chontales de Nicaragua, en donde la mayor parte de la población se dedica a la ganadería, Nohemi tiene su pequeña finca en donde  compra  ganado y vende, con esfuerzos propios y en conjunto con su familia principalmente de su esposo y sus 4 hijos menores de 15 años quienes le ayudan en las actividades productivas de esa manera buscan como salir adelante con la finca. El crédito que solicita es para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, desea reparar una parte de la cocina que se encuentra en mal estado. Para ella su principal objetivo en la vida es brindarles comodidad a su familia y que no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Nohemí, 35, lives in La Libertad, Chontales, Nicaragua.  Most of the population there works in animal husbandry.  Nohemí has her small farm where she raises livestock to sell.  With her own efforts and family help especially from her husband and four children under the age of 15 who help her with the productive activities she seeks ways to get ahead by means of the farm.

The loan she’s requesting is for home improvements.  She wants to repair part of the kitchen that’s in poor condition.  Her main objective in life is to provide comfort for her family and that they never lack daily bread.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Jerrynson Manuel

texts.es:
Jerrynson es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar Jerrynson no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar básquet y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su Padre,  Jerrynson trabaja como ayudante de construcción en diversas obras, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jerrynson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, la cual le servirá de mucho, ya que actualmente  cuenta con una pequeña cocina a kerosene y leña, la cual presenta desperfectos y es peligroso su uso, de esta manera Jerrynson y su familia podrán preparar adecuadamente sus alimentos y a la vez tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Jerrynson seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrea profesional.
texts.en:
Jerrynson is a 23 year old man, single, and lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind person, hardworking and enthusiastic, who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the necessity of working Jerrynson could not study the career of Auto Mechanics. In his free time he likes to play basketball and sometimes to cook the delicious Aji de Gallina (chicken in a spicy sauce with peanuts) to share with his family.

With a lot of effort, dedication and thanks to the support of his father, Jerrynson works as a construction worker in several locations. He works every day due to his good performance and the friendly treatment he gives to others.

Jerrynson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the assistance he can buy a stove, which will be very useful, as currently he has a small kerosene and wood stove which is flawed and dangerous to use. So Jerrynson and his family will properly prepare their food and at the same time will have better security and wellbeing, so Jerrynson can continue working and struggling to achieve his dream of studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 30 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos  y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Pedro no pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de control y manejo e maquinaria pesada, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver partidos de futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Estofado de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pedro trabaja como obrero en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, adicionalmente por las tardes trabaja vendiendo ropa en un pequeño puesto de ventas que tiene en un mercadillo, Pedro trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amble que brinda a sus clientes.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir, los cuales le servirán de mucho para abastecer su negocio y atender a mas clientes, así pues Pedro seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una pequeña empresa.
texts.en:
Pedro’s a 30-year-old, single man living in the city of Pisco. He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong wish for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and because he needed to start working while still very young, Pedro was unable to study a technical career in heavy machinery operation.  In his free time he enjoys watching soccer matches and sometimes cooks a delicious ‘Estofado de Pollo’ to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Pedro works as a laborer for a municipal firm in his city and in addition sells clothes in the evenings in a small stand he has in a small market.  Pedro works every day for about 12 hours and thinks he does well because of the good way he works and the kind treatment he provides his customers.

Pedro is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy a larger amount and variety of clothe that will be very useful for him to stock his business thus attracting more customers.  Pedro will thus be able to continue working and striving to reach his greatest dream: to own a small firm.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Don Jose de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 13 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, El es comerciante de verduras. Inicio su negocio en el año 2009. Utiliza su vehiculo en el que coloca jabas para exhibir las verduras, el se transporta con su vehiculo en las diferentes colonias que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia ofreciendo su mercaderia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar. Don Jose solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas verduras: tomates, cebollas, aguacates, etc. y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
José, 48, lives in his own house with his wife and three children who are 19, 17 and 13 years of age and currently attending school.  He’s a vegetable merchant.  He started his business in 2009.  He sets up crates in his vehicle to display the vegetables.  He uses his vehicle to transport himself to various neighborhoods near his home to sell his merchandise.  With profits earned he’s able to cover household expenses.

José’s requesting a loan to buy more vegetables like tomatoes, onions, avocados, etc. to earn higher profits give his family what they need with no limitation whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Solidario Trabajadoras Con Exito Group

texts.es: Solidario Trabajadoras Con Exito, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Yesica Elizabeth, de 20 años de edad soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de cajas de madera para transportar verduras ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de madera para seguir elaborando cajas para transportar verduras y asi de esa forma seguir luchando para salir adelante y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
One of the members of the solidarity group Solidario Trabajadoras Con Exito (Workers with Success), is Yesica Elizabeth, who is 20 years old, single, and makes a living making wooden boxes used to transport vegetables. 

She has been doing this work for several years, and is requesting this loan for the purchase of wood in order to continue making boxes for vegetable transport, and in that way continue fighting to get ahead and have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make wooden boxes for transporting vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building an artisan oven and to purchase supplies for baking her bread, such as fine and coarse flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Jayme Paul

texts.es:
Jayme es un hombre de 41 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por  falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jayme no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Jayme trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de plásticos, sandalias de plásticos y artículos para el hogar, el trabaja todos los días en un pequeño puesto de ventas por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Jayme se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como escobas, bolsas plásticas, tachos, baldes, sandalias y otros, de esta manera Jayme tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jayme, 41, is single living in the city of Pisco; he’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong wish for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start working at a very young age, Jayme was unable to study Law like he’d wanted to.  In his free time he enjoys continuing to work and on some occasions cooks a delicious ‘Carapulcra con Sopa Seca’ to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Jayme works in his small business selling plastics, plastic sandals and items for the home.  He works every day in his small sales stand for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his good prices and the kind customer service he provides.

Jayme is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy merchandise like brooms, plastic bags, waste baskets, buckets, sandals, and others in greater amounts and wider variety.  In this way, Jayme will have his business better stocked and will be able to take care of more customers.  Thus, he will continue working and striving toward reaching his great dream: to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Sandatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! A married mother of a three-year-old, 25-year-old Sandatu is from Tombo Western, a rural area of Freetown. Since 2007, Sandatu has run a general store selling sodas, biscuit, milk, sugar and bread. She works at the business nine hours per day, seven days per week. She says that despite hardships, she is very hardworking and wants to become successful.

Sandatu has requested a loan in order to buy a variety of foodstuffs including sodas, biscuits, milk, sugar and bread. The extra resulting income will allow her to expand her business and repay her loan. In the future, Sandatu plans to expand her enterprise even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a variety of foodstuffs including sodas, biscuits, milk, sugar and bread.

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayuda r a su familia, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como conserje en un centro parroquial de su ciudad, el trabaja realizando labores de limpieza, pintado y todo lo que se requiera en cuanto al cuidado y mantenimiento del centro parroquial, Luis trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de una habitación en su hogar, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso, pues actualmente la habitación está deteriorada, de esta manera Luis y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, is single living in Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong wish for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start work at a very young age, Luis was unable to study business administration like he’d wanted to.  In his free time he enjoys listening to music and on some occasions cooks a delicious fried chicken to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Luis works as a caretaker at a local parochial center.  He works doing cleaning chores, painting and anything else needed for the proper maintenance of the parochial center.  Luis works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of the good way he does his work and the kind way he treats others.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to do some improvements to one of the rooms at home.  He wants to seal the walls, paint and install flooring because the room is currently in bad shape.  In this way, Luis and his family will have greater security and well-being and he will continue to work and strive toward reaching his great dream: to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: Sandra una joven de 25 años casada con una hija.  Hace más de 02 años que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y calzados, la cual lo realiza a pedidos, ya que por el momento no cuenta con un local donde poder ofrecer dichos productos. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo a podido cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como comprar su propia casa. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de calzados y chompas por temporada. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. Sandra es integrante la Alcancía Comunal “Luchando Por Un Sueño” conformado por 07 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables que tienes como fin seguir mejorando cada día. Ella está ubicada en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho y viste blusa negra con puntos blancos. El grupo agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindad.
texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old, married with a daughter. For more than two years she has been working selling clothing and footwear, taking orders, as at the moment she does not have a facility where she can offer the merchandise.

Thanks to her work and effort she could fulfill some of her dreams such as buying her own home. Her latest loan will be used to buy seasonal shoes and sweaters. Her greatest desire is to finish building her house. 

Sandra is a member of the Alcancía Communal Bank “Luchando Por Un Sueño” made up of seven women entrepreneurs and managers whose purpose is to continue improving every day. She is located in the back, second from the right side, wearing a black blouse with white spots. 

The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy footwear and sweaters

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is a 28-year-old married father of two children, ages four and one-and-one-half years. Parviz owns a manufacturing shop specializing in setting floors and roofs. He established his business in 2006 and has gained good experience thus far in his career. Parviz is becoming well-known in the surrounding area and is continuously gaining the respect of his neighborhood. He has no extra income and his labor is the only support of his family.

Parviz's son needs medical treatment and surgery for his cleft palate. Parviz is therefore requesting a loan of AZN 1500 as he dreams of seeing his son healthy.

loans.use: To cover the treatment and surgical expenses of his son.

loans.name: Mirza Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mirza de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, tiene un negocio de venta de carteras y ropa interior para damas y caballeros en un mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene 6 años de tener su negocio, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su casa, Doña mirza esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi pueda obtener mejores ganancias y poder tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en: Mirza, 46, lives in her own house with her family.  She has a business selling purses and underwear for women and men in a local market near her residence.  She’s been in business six years.  She uses profits earned to cover household expenses.  Mirza is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business in order to earn higher profits and to be able to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy purses and underwear.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.ru: Рукия женщина с добрым сердцем и конкретными целями организовать бизнес. Рукия 44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж Абдуламат простой рабочий и получает маленькую зарплату. Рукия хочет организовать свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как она умеет шить очень красивые платья. Рукия будет шить платья для своих клиентов у себя дома, так как много соседи желают быть ее клиентами. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2400 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rukiya is a woman with a kind heart and solid plans to start a new business. Rukiya is 44 years old. She is married and raising two children. Her husband Abdulamat is a simple worker and receives a small salary. Rukiya wants to start her own business sewing women's clothing because she can sew beautiful dresses. Rukiya will sew dresses for her customers at home as many of her neighbors wish to be her customers. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,400 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for a new business.

loans.name: Frank Edgardo

texts.es:
Frank es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Frank se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Mariscos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Frank trabaja como asistente en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Frank se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder construir una habitación en casa de sus padres, de esta manera Frank y su familia contaran con un ambiente adecuado y seguro, así pues Frank seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Frank’s a 21-year-old, single man living in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to his efforts and support from his parents, Frank is studying Law.  In his free time he likes to spend time reading and sometimes cooks delicious rice with seafood to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Frank works as an assistant in a municipal firm in his city.  He works every day for about 8 hours and thinks he does well because of the good way he carries out his duties and the kind way he treats others.

Frank is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy building supplies to add a room onto his parents’ house.  In this way, Frank and his family will have a more secure, proper environment and Frank can continue working and striving to reach his great dream of becoming a great professional.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Mrs. Asunta was born in the city of Calca but lives in the Jajahuana community (this community is located in the Challabamba district, within the Paucartambo province and Cusco department, Perú). She is 58 years old, married and has six children. She belongs to Santa Isabel of Jajahuana Communal Bank and their main economic activities are agriculture and livestock. 

Asunta plants and cultivates corn, potatoes, barley, wheat and other dry products. She takes these dry products to sell in the cities of Challabamba and Cusco where she distributes them to the different wholesale markets in those cities. At this time, Asunta needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She's happy about the loan and pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his taxi cab.

loans.name: Emma Kaila

texts.es:
Emma es una mujer de 25 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; con mucho esfuerzo Emma se encontraba estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Alimentos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, Emma no pudo culminar sus estudios, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Emma trabaja como empleada en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días brindando atención al cliente y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Emma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una refrigeradora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder conservar y  mantener en mejor estado sus alimentos y bebidas, así pues Emma seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Emma’s a 25-year-old, single woman living in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong wish for self-improvement.  With much effort, Emma’s had been studying the professional career of food engineering.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start working, Emma was unable to complete her studies.  In her free time she enjoys dancing and sometimes cooks delicious chicken with rice to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Emma is employed at a commercial firm in her city.  She works every day providing customer service and thinks she does well because of the good way she does her work and the kind way she treats others.

Emma is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she’ll be able to buy a refrigerator that will be very useful for her to keep her food and beverages in good condition.  Emma will thus continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to complete her professional career.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a handrail for the stairs.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos  de los cuales uno se encuentra en la escuela, viven en casa alquilada, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Estrellas de Belén  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Pastora estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la venta al por mayor de prendas de vestir (calcetines) en la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital y comprar más calcetines  al por mayor para de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Pastora es tener su casita propia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Pastora is a single mother and has two children who are all in school. She lives in a rented house that is located in the district of Estrellas de Belén in the city of El Alto. 
Pastora finished secondary school and is currently running her own business selling clothing accessories, like socks, in the city of El Alto. 
She needs a loan because she wants to increase her working capital and to purchase more socks in bulk so that, in this way, she will be able to improve her earnings and her quality of life. 
Her dream is to have her own home. 
This is the first loan she is asking for with IMPRO and also her first with KIVA.

loans.use: purchase socks in bulk.

loans.name: Shirley Geraldine

texts.es:
Shirley es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y cogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y recibe muchos turistas en todo el año ya que posee playas hermosas.  Shirley es u a joven con muchas ganas de progresar, es por ello que desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente y por ello trabaja en una pequeña institución como auxiliar y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y puntual.

Shirley está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un pequeño local en el mercado de su ciudad e iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Shirley is a young woman who is 21 years of age.  She lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for having a very warm and inviting climate.  In addition, this area has a developed agricultural sector and receives many tourists throughout the year because of its beautiful beaches.  Shirley has tremendous drive to make progress.  At a very young age, she learned that she had to earn her way through the sweat of her brow.  She works as an assistant at a small institution and is able to help her parents with the household expenses.  Shirley believes she is doing well in her work because she is responsible and punctual.

She is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the support they have provided, Shirley will be able to buy a small shop at the city market where she can start a grocery business.  As a result, she will be able to improve her income and continue striving toward fulfilling her greatest wish of studying for a university degree and having a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy a small shop in order to start a grocery business.

loans.name: Lakita

texts.en:
Little Rock hair stylist Lakita aims to launch a new type of beauty salon. In addition to offering spa treatments, facials, pedicures, manicures, hair styling and natural beauty products, Lakita’s business – "Sole Harmony" – hopes to help people find their inner beauty. “Sole Harmony" deals with every core: mental, emotional, as well as physical beauty and well-being,” she says. “So we're going to do workshops to deal with those issues as well. This is a new concept. It's not been done here. We are taking an inside-out approach to beauty and well-being.”

Lakita said she got the idea for her business from listening to her clients over the course of her 30 years of work as a licensed hair stylist. “You realize that people cover themselves up with cosmetics and make their hair pretty and drive fancy cars and buy these big houses, but there’s a void. There’s something missing,” Lakita says. “So how do you service those needs? That’s where this was derived from – serving a deeper need.”

To jump-start her business, Lakita received a loan from the Little Rock extension of ACCION Texas. She is using her working capital loan to build a website, from which she will host webinars on wellness topics. Additionally, she is buying inventory for the retail part of her business. She intends to sell all natural beauty products in her business.

Lakita said she learned about ACCION through her aunt, a business owner who advised her to go right to ACCION. “I was looking for someone who helped start-up businesses, people who didn’t have credit but needed start-up funding, and she told me to go to ACCION,” she says. Without ACCION’s help, Lakita says she would have been delayed in the start of her business. “I would have continued working my full-time job until I could save the money,” she says. “It’s giving me a sense of security, knowing this money is helping me start and expand my business.”

Once she launches her business, Lakita plans to contract with five beauty and wellness consultants. “I’m excited and nervous at the same time,” she says. “I believe this is a service that is needed. I believe there is a market for this.”

loans.use: to pay for inventory and purchase a website.

loans.name: Willson

texts.es:
Willson es casado y tiene tres hijos, un varón y dos mujeres que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Ventilla de la Ciudad del Alto.
Actualmente trabaja de chofer asalariado y la esposa también ayuda en el trabajo y al cuidado de los hijos,  ellos trabajan todos los días de la semana, ambos  colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta, y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para mantenimiento y reparación de la movilidad que maneja ya que es su única fuente de ingreso, la ruta y el recorrido están llenos de tierra y polvo y el dueño de la movilidad le ha puesto como condición para seguir trabajando que el costo de mantenimiento del vehículo sea por cuenta de Willson.
El sueño de Willson es poder contar con movilidad propia que sea su herramienta que le facilitará mejorar sus ingresos y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en: Willson is married with three school-aged children (one boy and two girls).  The house in which he lives is his own and has a living room, a bedroom, a kitchen and a bathroom.  The dwelling is made of adobe with a cement floor and is situated in the Ventilla district of Ciudad del Alto.
