Primo is 39 years old, married, with two children. He lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates a crab-vending business. He has been in his business for over five years and earns PHP 10,000 every month. 

Primo joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 and now he has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional crabs to sell. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with two children. She is forty years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Jocelyn sells crabs and shrimps to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns about PHP 9,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of ten thousand five hundred pesos to buy crabs and shrimps for her business. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy crabs and shrimps for her retail business.

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en:
Lonie's main source of income comes from his gardening business. He is 31 years old, married and from Macabayao, Jimenez. He has been gardening for three years and earns PHP 4,000 a month. 

In 2011, Lonie joined GDMPC. Lonie is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling only to junior high school. Mavis started selling grains at Likpe Bakua Market in Hohoe, which she had done for 3 years when she realized that the family could not depend on her husband’s income only. Her husband is a business man. Mavis uses her income to help her husband provide for their four children. Mavis will use the loan to purchase bags of rice. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mavis plans to save to enable her to sell her grains in large quantity.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en: Louis is married and has 6 children. He is an educationist. Louis got into petty trading at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, over the past two years after retiring from active service. His wife is also a petty trader. Louis uses his income for the general financial needs of his family. He will use the loan to purchase bags of paddy rice and maize from local farmers for resale to men and women at the market and also to other middle men. With the new profits from his expanded business, Louis plans to save for his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to purchase bags of paddy rice and maize from local farmers for resale at the market and also to other middle men.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy inventory for her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of 600 USD. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Sreymom is 24 years old and married, with three children. 

Sreymom and her husband earn a living through planting rice and sesame. Having been in this business for six years, she manages to earn about KHR 22,000 per day and she can save about KHR 7,000 each day for the future needs.

Sreymom has been a member of VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles. She completely paid back the past loan which helped her better support her family. 

Now, she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use some of her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland and some of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income, to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Japeth

texts.en:
Japeth is a fisherman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income. 

Japeth wants to expand his business, but he lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, he joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to micro-entrepreneurs like him. 

He is asking for a loan worth PHP 5,000 to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks. Through this loan, he will be able to enhance his catch and sell more fish to the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks.

loans.name: Benje

texts.en:
Benje is 29 years old and single. He lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been in his business for over three years and earns PHP 4,000 every month. 

Benje joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 and now he has requested a loan of PHP 8,700 to purchase spare parts and tires. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Mawugnon 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUGNON 2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des voisines de quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lucie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Lucie est âgée de 43 ans et n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Lucie est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Hyacinth. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges du ménage, Lucie vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) depuis depuis près de vingt ans. Lucie s’approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Lucie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWUGNON 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The MAWUGNON 2 group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, whose name is Lucie, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. Lucie is 43 years old and did not go to school. She is married to a driver named Hyacinth. Lucie and Hyacinth have four children, all of whom live in their care and all of whom have received schooling.

In order to cover the various household expenses, Lucie has been selling food (rice with sauce) for nearly twenty years now. She stocks up at a market in Benin.

Striving to satisfy her customers and increase both her sales and revenue, Lucie, along with the other members of the MAWUGNON 2 group, is seeking a second loan through ALIDé. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 26-year-old Nancy from rural Waterloo, Western Area. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 8. Two of her children are attending school. 

Nancy runs a local soap business; she sells soap. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business from 8:30am until 6:30pm, 6 days per week. Nancy says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of capital.

Nancy has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil and soap powder to expand her soap business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she hopes to open a soap factory. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and soap powder to expand her soap business.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 47-year-old married man and a father to two sons and two daughters; their ages are between 18 and 10 years old. Raed is a local university employee who gets a small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Raed wants to improve his living conditions and make his life easier, so he is requesting a 3,000 USD  loan from FATEN to help him complete the price of purchasing a vehicle. Taking this loan will enable Raed to own a personal vehicle, which will facilitate his movement and also the rest of his family members.

Raed is in the picture in front of his vehicle.

loans.use: To complete the price of the vehicle

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 22-year-old married man with no children yet. Yasser is a worker who gets a small salary, which is not big enough to cover all their costs.

Yasser has been building a new house and now he wants to finish it, so he is requesting a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting the house and installing tiles and doors. Taking this loan will offer Yasser and his wife suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their new house soon.

Yasser is photographed inside his new house.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Brisas De Abril Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo de tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ellas es Eidy tiene 25 años de edad, soltera, con cinco años de vender carne de res ambulantes y en  los mercados de Masaya, comunidad, y vecinos, es su primer crédito en la institución con muchas expectativas de salir adelante y desarrollar su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carne de res como posta de pierna, hueso, pellejos, mondongo, recortes, lomos etc. Carmen empresaria de 24 años de edad su negocio es la venta de pinolillo, semillas de jícaro, tiste en polvo y Teresa tiene 65 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio
texts.en:
The Brisas de Abril (April Breezes) Group is made up of three successful, entrepreneuriaul women. One of the group members, Eidy, is 25 years old and single. Eidy has been selling beef for five years in the markets of Masaya, as well as in her neighborhood to members of her community. This is her first loan with the institution, and she is very hopeful that this investment will help her to grow and strengthen her business. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase different meaty portions of the cow (ribs, flank, tripe, trimmings, loin, etc.) for resale at her business.

Carmen, another group member, is 24 years old and makes a living selling ground cornmeal, gourd seeds and other items. Teresa, the third group member, is 65 years old and operates a small convenience store out of her home.

loans.use: to purchase beef cuts and various cow parts (ribs, flank, tripe, trimmings, loin, etc.) for resale at her meat business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 60 years old, married with three children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish vending business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 9,300 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell.

In the future, Carmen wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old, married with four children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food vending business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over seven years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représente du groupe Dina Mètohoun âgée de 44 ans est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Dina Mètohoun n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dina Mètohoun est mariée à un certain Ezéchiel. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Dina Mètohoun vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Dina Mètohoun assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Dina Mètohoun mène comme activité principale la vente de maïs. De façon secondaire, Dina Mètohoun prépare de l'"akassa"(pâte fait à base d'amidon de maïs), qu'elle vend dans sa région. Dina Mètohoun s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Dina Mètohoun sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Mahukpego group is composed of three members living in the same house. The group’s representative, Dina Mètohoun, 44 years of age, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Dina Mètohoun did not attend school. Her husband’s name is Ezéchiel. They have six children, some of whom are in school. In addition to their own children, the spouses also have two other children in their care. Dina Mètohoun lives together with her husband and children and, together with her husband, provides for household needs. In order to meet her various expenses, Dina Mètohoun sells corn as her main business activitiy. In addition, she cooks “akassa” [a thick cornmeal porridge], which she sells locally. Dina Mètohoun stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to better meet the expectations of her growing customer base and increase her revenues, Dina Mètohoun, together with the other members of the Mahukpego group, is seeking a sixth loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.en:
Maria is a Kubo.financiero borrower. This is his story:

My name is Maria de Jesus, I am 62 years old, married and have two old sons. I studied until elementary school and then left school to work. We own a house in a neighborhood called Nezahuaycoyotl (a municipality in Mexico which is part of one of the world's largets slums).

I have been working selling stationary for more than 20 years. I own a store, that is called "Papelería y Regalos Escorpio" , my slogan is: "we have everything that you need". I started very small and have been growing the business slowly. The purpose of the loan is to buy stationary and backpacks to increase my sales during the back to school season, which is the best of the year.

My store is located in a large avenue and is surrounded by six schools. The store has approximately 8 square meters of space, I sell different types of products such as: stationary, gifts, candies, and backpacks. I also sell lottery tickets.

My biggest accomplishment has been able to provide financial stability for my kids and make some trips. My biggest goal is to grow my business.

loans.use: to buy stationary and backpacks for the back to school season

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is a Kubo.financiero borrower. This is his story:

My name is Bernarda, I am 54 years old. My husband died 16 years ago, so I had to take care of my five children, which have grown and now they work on their own.

I own a house and all my savings are in the business, I have two locals in a market called Jamaica, I have work extremely hard  to provide for my family and leave them with some assets. I will like them to follow me in the business and continue with the tradition of selling corn products, which is a very old mexican tradition, like selling nopal ( a type of cactus).

My project is called: "Jamaica Vive" which means Jamaica lives. I called it  that way, because my food stall is located in the Jamaica Market, and I believe that with the refurbishing, I will be able to improve the image of my business and attract more clients.

I work buying and selling crude corn. I also cook different products made of corn such as: esquites, corn pie, corn on the cob, etc.

I started my business 35 years ago, my husband had a local in the Jamaica market and now I have two. I work in one and my daughter works in the other one. 

My biggest accomplishment has been providing stability for my kids.

loans.use: to refurbished her food stall, fix gas pipes and paint and buy new grills.

loans.name: Magaly Elisabeth

texts.en:
Magaly is a Kubo.financiero borrower. This is his story:

My name is Magaly, I am 31 years old. I am a very responsible person, I have been married for 8 years and have 3 beautiful children ages 6, 4 and 1.

I live with my in-laws and fortunately I have a very good relation with them. I used to work for a company, but when I started having babies, it became impossible, so I started making tamales (mexican food made of corn) and sell them. I am a fighter because I want to build a safety net for my children and because of that I'm willing to work very hard now that I am young. Of course, I also take very seriously my responsibility as a wife, mother and partner.

Fortunately, my business is growing rapidly and I need the loan to build a cellar where I can put the corn leafs and other inputs that I use to make the tamales such as: chile, chocolate, cinamon and other species. In the future, I'll like to buy a mill. By building the cellar, I will be able to buy inputs in larger quantities and get better prices. I know this is a big expense, but I am confident that my business will benefit greatly and I will be able to pay the loan.

I will like to add, that I start cooking the tamales at 3 AM, because the tamales need to be warm and ready at 6 AM.  I started my business 4 years ago and my biggest accomplishment is that it has been growing since.

loans.use: To build a cellar to keep material that she uses to make tamales.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru and also practices mining. He was able to pay school fees for his children from his previous loan. He has applied for his eighth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a plot of land after paying his previous loan successfully.

He hopes to build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. 

In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Belly works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Belly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport.

Belly has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be social. 

Sammy operates a motorcycle repair and spare parts shop where he sells motorcycle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with many motorcycle riders, and his primary customers are motorcycle riders. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy stock of motorcycle spare parts. 

Sammy’s business goal is to expand the business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is taking a loan of USD 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin (TRM). She is married, has two children, and her husband is a working businessman. 

Rosita has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. 

She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags. She is happy with TRM that they offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags to sell.

loans.name: Mzimuni Group

texts.en:
Jane, a member of the Mzimuni group, has been managing her family by running a business selling rice up-country. She has been in this business for a period of three years now. Jane, who is in her late 30s, is married with seven children (three girls and four boys) who are in school. She is doing fine in this field and the family is also. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be her sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she managed to purchase more sacks of rice, which she resold to more clients in other regions. With the profit earned, she covered school fees for her children, covered home costs and reinvested into the business. She will use this loan to increase her stock of rice. Jane dreams to expand her rice business more.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mzimuni, which totals eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of rice.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mbelwa Group

texts.en:
Ritha, a member of this group, has been running a business which sells fruit for three years now. She is a widow who is in her early 30s. Ritha has three children who are all in school. She works from 6:00am to 4:00pm daily and is able to make a fair profit each month. 

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, which she repaid successfully, to order more fruit for her business. With the profit she earned, Ritha paid school fees for her children. She will use this loan to start ordering stocks of fruit from the inland part of the country. She dreams that she will soon finish building her house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mbelwa, which includes 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying the loan back.

loans.use: to order additional stocks of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana sells groceries and other household products at a market. She has previously used a loan from KIVA to expand her product offering and it turned out well for her business and her profit. Liana was able to improve her living conditions by doing a small renovation in her home. 

Recently, Liana faced some challenges. A grocery store opened nearby and  attracted some of Liana’s customers. Soon people saw that the prices in the grocery store are higher, while the quality is lower. Now Liana’s business is going well and Liana hopes it will be so in future.

This time Liana is requesting a loan of 8,000 Gryvnas to purchase sugar, grains, flour, tea, and coffee. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional profit.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, grains, flour, tea, and coffee

loans.name: Asghar

texts.en:
Mr. Asghar is a very kind and hardworking man. He belongs to a poor family and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of three sons and two daughters. He owns a steel and metal reshaping shop in the main market. 

For the past few days, the machine has not been working properly, which means that he is unable to complete his work on time. This issue is creating a lot of financial problems as well, as he is unable to generate sufficient income. He wants to repair the machine as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult.

Therefore, he has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to cover the cost of repairing the machine that he uses for working with metal and steel. He hopes that the loan will help him to repair the machine as soon as possible so that he can continue his work. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing machinery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vaccines and medicines for the sustainability of her hogs

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 42-year-old, married man, from Tagbilaran, Bohol. He has been engaged in a tricycle transport business for more than ten years now. This is the source of his income.

Felix is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like wheel tires and nuts and bolts, and to pay for the repair of the vehicle. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his income, thus allowing him to provide for the needs of the family, such as their daily food consumption. 

In the future, Felix hopes of exploring another venture, to augment his current business and to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like wheel tires and nuts and bolts, and to pay for the repair of the vehicle.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.en: Otilia is taking out a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), and she is married. She has 4 children. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about running a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) because they offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en:
Olinda runs a kiosk, which she has been doing since 2008, to generate income for her family.  She started her business with her own working capital of $30.00. 

Olinda is requesting a loan for $1,000.00, which she will use to purchase slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks, and biscuits to improve her business. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks, and biscuits

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 42 años de edad se caracteriza por se una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Erasmo y sus hijos en la casa de material rústico que compró hace algunos años. Desde muy temprano a primera horas del día, se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas a cortar alfalfa que venderá en el mercado de la ciudad, comenta que llega a vender un promedio de 30 fardos de alfalfa y en temporada de sequía es donde duplica su ganancia. Como buena negociante también se dedica a la siembra de papa y maíz, “estos son los productos más comerciales”, comenta. Es por esa razón que desea mejorar la calidad y productividad de sus terrenos agrícolas y poder de esa manera vender a mejor precio los alimentos. Espera que con el abono orgánico pueda tener mejora calidad y así lograr su objetivo. Este es el cuarto crédito con Kiva, espera concretar sus planes, con el apoyo financiero que recibe , por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.Mary, invertirá los S/3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Mary, age 42, is known for being a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband, Erasmo, and their children.  They live in a house made from basic materials, which they bought some years ago.

Starting from the very early hours in the day, she heads to her agricultural land to cut alfalfa, which she will sell at the market in the city.  She says that she comes to sell an average of 30 bales of alfalfa.  During the dry season she doubles her profits.  As a good businesswoman, she also grows potatoes and corn.  “These are the products that sell the most,” she says.  

This is the reason that she wishes to improve the quality and productivity of her farm land.  She wants to do this to be able to sell the food for a better price.  She hopes that with the organic fertilizer she will be able to have a better quality and, therefore, mange to achieve her objective.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva.  She hopes to firm up her plans with the financial support she will receive.  She pledges to make her payments.  Mary will use 3,800 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en: Exaltacion is 60 years old, married with four children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase products to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ekua Faustina

texts.en: Ekua Faustina operates a retail business in Dompoase (near Cape Coast).  Ekua Faustina is divorced with 6 children.  As the sole breadwinner in her family, Ekua Faustina uses her income to provide for her entire family. Ekua Faustina will use the loan to purchase other provisions, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.  As a middle school graduate, Ekua Faustina understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: To purchase other provisions, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua  is single and has six children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Efua  is a successful businesswoman. She sells corn dough  in Dompoase  (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about seven years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family.  

Efua  will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of corn dough, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business,  Efua  plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: purchase increased amounts of corn dough.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. She previously accessed a 26,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 28,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams that her business will continue to prosper. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise, products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Rita decided to set up her own "Wakye" selling business (Wakye is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She prepares her Wakye on her own and proceeds to sell it in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). With over 5 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty Wakye. She wants to use the profit from her business to help support her husband (who is a contractor) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their 2 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty "Wakye"

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 56 years old, married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a furniture making business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested 8,000 PHP to purchase raw materials. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Nana   is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She usually sells her ‘Gari’ in Dompoase  (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ for three years.  

Nana is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Nana  wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Gari’. In the long term,  Nana plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is 40-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and four children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2008, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. Due to the large family size and low monthly income, they are facing many problems. Her husband needs additional capital for the growth of his business. Nabeela has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can invest in her husband’s shop.

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods like rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk and utility items for his general store, to satisfy his customers more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children. The profit amount would be used to expand the business and pay household expenses.

Nabeela and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her husband's  general store

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than five years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reparto Andres Vega Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es María tiene 29 años de edad, soltera, con cuatros hijos menores, desde hace dos años su negocio es la venta de comida, anteriormente trabajaba como domestica para el sustento de su familia, con sus pequeños ahorro fue adquiriendo inventario lo cual dio inicio a su negocio venta de comida. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de res, carne de pollo, arroz, tortilla, aceite, harina, repollo, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, plátano, vinagre, crema, salsa de tomate etc. Maritza tiene 28 años de edad su negocio es la venta de zapatos y Seneyda tiene 33 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortilla.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members.  María, age 29, is one of them.  She is single, and she has four minor children.

She has had her business of selling food for two years.  She previously worked as a domestic employee to support her family.  She started getting supplies with the small amount of savings that she had.  This was the start of her business of selling food.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients like beef, chicken, rice, tortillas, cooking oil, flour, cabbage, tomatoes, peppers, onions, bananas, vinegar, cream, and tomato sauce, etc.

Maritza, age 28, has a business selling shoes.  Seneyda, age 33, has a business making and selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 45, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Sofronio, who works abroad, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jocelyn operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal, or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter; ingredients that she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jocelyn dreams of having another branch for her bakery. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, baking powder, shortening, and other ingredients needed in making bread.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is taking a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk to generate income for her family. Lucia opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $700.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), biscuits, and cooking oil.  

Lucia is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), biscuits, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosibel mujer casada, con 35 años de edad, con un hijo, desde hace 6 años se dedica a vender ropa nueva por encargo, ambulante y a vecinos de su localidad, lleva varios crédito por que tiene 6 años de ser cliente de la institución ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, blusas de dama, camisas de varón, bóxer, shores, faldas, etc. Marlene tiene 40 años de edad su negocio tiene un cafetín en una universidad de la capital y Aura tiene 59 años su negocio es la venta de sandalias.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of these is Rosible, a married woman, 35 years old, with a child. For six years she has sold new clothing by order, on foot, and to neighbors in her locality.

She has had various loans because she has been a client of the institution for six years. She has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments. She will use the loan for the purchase of clothing like men’s pants, women’s pants, women’s blouses, men’s shirts, boxers, shorts, skirts, etc. 

Marlene is 40 years old. Her business is a small café in a university in the capital. Aura is 59 years old. Her business is the sale of sandals.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing like men's pants, women's pants, women's blouses, men's shirts, boxers, shorts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa, de 44 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Raúl y sus 2 hijos en la casa que compró hace 25 años. Jesusa realiza bellos bordados de prendas típicas y tejidos de chompas a lana, lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le permite ser independiente y también porque le permite  tener una vida tranquila con el ingreso necesario para su familia afirma que  aunque su trabajo suele ser  tranquilo  requiere de muy buena administración y control de las ventas diarias, es por eso que  Placida esta planificando crecer mas en su negocio.Este es el crédito número 5 con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su negocio,  así mismo se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .
Jesusa, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de lana y telas para su bordado.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 44 years old and is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Raul, and her two children in the home she bought 25 years ago.  Jesusa makes beautiful embroidered typical articles of clothing and wool sweaters.  What she likes most about this work is that is allows her to be independent and also to have a peaceful life with the income she needs for her family.  She says that even though her work is usually relaxing, it requires good management and control of daily sales.  This is the reason she is planning to grow her business.  This will be her fifth loan though Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she receives so she can continue her business.  She is also committed to be on time with her payments.

Jesusa will use the 1,000 PEN from this loan to buy yarn and fabric for embroidery.

loans.use: to buy fabric and yarn.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 53 años de edad , vive en compañía de su esposo Juan y sus hijos a los que cuida en la casa de material rústico que compró hace algunos años.Ella es una mujer dedicada, cuando tiene cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la zona, ganando de esa manera más dinero. “Vendiendo a los intermediarios no ganas mucho dinero”, afirma. Es así que durante todo el día cosecha sus productos para luego comercializarlos ella misma. Sus terrenos agrícolas son muy nutritivos, por lo que tiene buenos alimentos, grandes y sanos. Ahora desea incrementar su productividad y comenzar a cosechar productos orgánicos para poder tener clientes selectos y obtener buenos ingresos.Este es el cuarto crédito con Kiva, espera concretar sus planes, con el apoyo financiero que recibe , por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.Rosa, invertirá los S/. 3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years and lives with her husband, Juan, and their children.  They are raising the children in a house made of crude material that they bought some years ago. Rosa is a dedicated woman. At harvest time, she sells her produce in the zone's wholesale market, earning additional money in this manner. “Selling to middle men, you don't earn much money,” she affirms.

Thus, Rosa spends all day harvesting her products, to sell them herself later. Her agricultural fields are very fertile, producing good foodstuff -- large and healthy. Now, she wishes to increase her productivity and begin harvesting organic products, aiming for select customers and a better income.

This is Rosa's 4th loan with Kiva, and she hopes to realize her plans with the financial help she receives. She promises to comply with her schedule of payments. Rosa will invest the 3,000 sols in purchasing organic manure to nourish her plantings.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure for her fields and begin organic production.

loans.name: Ignacia Emilia

texts.es: Doña Ignacia, tiene la edad de 35 años con dos hijos de 11 y 10 años, su mayor deseo es verlos crecer y que no les falten el pan de cada día, siempre contando con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo, el único medio de ingresos de Ignacia es una pequeña pulpería, con la que busca como salir adelante con su familia y con este crédito que solicita desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda que le permita brindarle comodidad a sus hijos y contar con mejores condiciones de vida, por lo que se está esforzando para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 35 years old and has two children who are 11 and 10 years old. Her greatest desires are to see them grow and that they always have enough to eat. Ignacia can always count on the unconditional support of her spouse. Her only source of income is a small grocery store, with which she seeks to get ahead with her family.

The loan that she is asking for is to build a room in her home. This will help her provide comfort to her children and improve their living conditions, and it's for this reason that she is working hard to receive the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, iron, sand, and building stones.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 35 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su hija a la que cuida en la casa de material rústico de su hermana.Sus días se centran en el cuidado de sus 5 sobrinos, quienes quedaron huérfanos y junto a su familia, se apoyan en la crianza de los mismos, “toda la tarde me dedicó a ellos, somos lo único que tiene”, afirma. Mercedes se dedica a la crianza de cuyes , su éxito comenzó hace 2 años, cuando decidió incursionar en la crianza de estos animales, ahora ya tiene 150 ejemplares, siembra la alfalfa para alimentarlos y quiere más adelante ampliar su granja, pues cada 4 meses aumenta la producción. Es por ello que vende constantemente, los cuyes a los carniceros que llegan a su casa.Este es el cuarto crédito con Kiva y espera concretar sus planes, con el apoyo financiero que recibira , por otro lado se compromte a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Mercedes, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de cuyes y mantenimiento de su granja.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 35 years old, is a simple woman. She lives in the company of her daughter who she takes care of in the house constructed of rustic materials that belongs to her sister. Her days are centered on the care of her five nieces and nephews who were left as orphans, along with her family who support their upbringing. “All afternoon I’m dedicated to them. We are the only thing that they have,” she affirms.

Mercedes raises guinea pigs. Her success began two years ago, when she decided to dabble in the raising of those animals. Now she already has 150 specimens. She sows alfalfa to feed them and she later wants to grow her farm. Every four months the production increases. It is because of this that she constantly sells the guinea pigs to the butchers that come to her home.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she hopes to firm up her plans with the financial support that she will receive. On the other hand, she promises to make her payments punctually. Mercedes will invest the 3000 Nuevos Soles in the purchase of guinea pigs and the maintenance of her farm.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and maintain her farm.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is widowed and has five children.  Due to difficult circumstances Ekua  did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur.  She sells maize and palm fruit in Dompoase near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for 10 years.  Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.  

Ekua is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase an increased amount of maize and palm fruit, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase maize and palm fruit, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Emilsse Nadiheska

texts.es:
Emilsse Nadiheska es una joven de 26 años que habita en un barrio de  Managua, en casa de sus padres, ella es madre soltera con un hijo bajo su cargo, es trabajadora de una universidad privada donde se desempeña como secretaria  hace  dos años.

Se presento a la oficina de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como, bloque, cemento, hierro para poder construir una pequeña sala del comedor para tener mejor comodidad.

Espera con este financiamiento poder invertirlo y seguir apoyando a sus padres en la construcción y espera la  oportunidad que le puedan brindarle, para poder hacer realidad unos de sus sueños y agradece la ayuda para mejor su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Emilsse Nadiheska is a young 26-year-old who lives in a neighbourhood of Managua in her parents' home. She is a single mother with a child in her care. She works at a private university where she has been employed as a secretary for two years.

She came to the Ceprodel office to ask for a loan to buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and iron, so that she can construct a small dining room and have more comfort.  

With this financing, she hopes to be able to invest and continue to support her parents in the construction. She awaits the opportunity that it can bring her, to make some of her dreams a reality. She is thankful for the help in improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Cupido Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es María tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, con tres hijos. Su negocio consiste en la venta de pollo actividad que viene realizando desde hace 10 años, lleva 16 préstamos osea 6 años de ser cliente de la institución siendo responsable en sus obligaciones, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pollos enteros, pollo en piezas, pechuga, muslos, piernas, alas, titil, hígado etc. Nubia es una microempresaria de 58 años su negocio es  una pulpería en su domicilio y Raquel tiene 29 años y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising, successful members.  One of them is María, 45.  She’s married and has three children.  Her business is selling chicken, an activity she’s been in for ten years.  She’s had 16 loans, that is, she’s been a client of the institution for six years; she’s been responsible with her obligations.  She will use the loan to buy whole chickens, chicken parts, breasts, thighs, wings, gizzards, livers, etc.

Nubia’s a 58-year-old micro businesswoman and her business is a home-based grocery store; Raquel, 29, sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy whole chickens and chicken parts.

loans.name: El Halcon Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxitos una de ella es Miriam mujer de 43 años de edad, acompañada, con un hijo. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta y compra de cosechas de tamarindo, es un producto de mayor demanda para esta época, tiene 8 años de ser cliente de la institución, su hijo mayor le ayuda en el acopio y comercialización del tamarindo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cinco palos de tamarindos, bolsas etc. José tiene 56 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y venta de nacatamales y Eveling tiene 22 años y su negocio es la venta de frutas frescas.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful, enterprising members.  One of them is Miriam, a 43-year-old woman who has a spouse and a son.  She’s been buying up tamarind crops to resell for the last 15 years.  Her product is in high demand this season.  She’s been a client of the institution for 8 years.  Her oldest son helps her consolidate and sell the tamarind.  She will use the loan to buy five tamarind trees, bags, etc.

José, 56, makes and sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] and Eveling, 22, sells fresh fruit.

loans.use: to buy tamarind, bags, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling Wakye (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She usually sells her ‘Wakye in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling Wakye for two years. Ama  is married and has six children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty Wakye. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is a 37-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and six children. Since 2007, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central market. Due to the increase in the demand of the customers, Gulshan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. He would also build one more room to add some more space to his shop. Her husband is very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis, Occidental. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010. She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase pig feed. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 43-year-old, very kind, honest and hardworking person. He belongs to a poor family. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of three sons and three daughters.

Since 1992, he has been running a small shop in the small market near his house, which is the only source of income for the family. He makes rickshaw steel bodies. He has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase steel rods and iron sheets for his business. He is feeling confident after taking this loan. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase steel rods and iron sheets for making rickshaw steel bodies.

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa is a small-scale fruit vendor in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a tailor. Abenawa has been working as a fruit vendor for close to seven years. As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fruit, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of operating a fruit stand, giving her a fixed selling location in the future.

loans.use: purchase an increased quantity of fruit, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola, de 47 años de edad, esta casada con Humberto quien es agricultor. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja y sus 2 hijos.La actividad que realiza Lola es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para esto cuenta con una bodega que estableció hace algún tiempo en su propia casa debido a la necesidad económica que atravesaba su familia en aquel entonces. Entre los productos que ofrece a la venta tiene arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, harina, fideos, plátanos entre otros. Lleva ya 1 año ejerciendo esta labor y por fortuna le ha ido bien desde que se inició. Recibe el apoyo de su hija. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso adicional con el cual puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos básicos del hogar.El resultado positivo que evidencia  su negocio la motiva a seguir adelante e implementarlo con mayor cantidad de productos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales.Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, azúcar, leche y huevos para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Lola, 47, is married to Humberto who is a farmer.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and two children.  The activity Lola carries out is selling basic staple grocery items and to do so she has a store that she set up some time ago at home due to the economic need her family was experiencing at the time.  Among the products she sells are rice, sugar, eggs, milk, flour, noodles and bananas, among others.  

She’s been in business for a year and this makes it possible for her to earn extra income to help her husband with basic household expenses.  The positive result her business is having motivates her to continue forward stocking it with a larger amount of goods.   

On this occasion, she’s requesting 1,000 soles.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s being given to reach her work goals.  She will use the requested amount to buy rice, sugar, milk and eggs to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida nació en la ciudad de Challabamba y desde hace varios años que radica en la ciudad de Salvación.  (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Brigida tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella tiene un local de hospedaje, una tienda de abarrotes y un restaurante. Ya son 13 años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, agua mineral, gaseosas, refrescos, fideos, tarros de leche y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Brigida was born in the city of Challabamba and has resided in the city of Salvación for many years. (Salvación is located in the district of Manu, in the province of Manu, within the region of Madre de Dios, Peru.)

Brigida is 40 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has two children. She has a lodging house, a grocery store, and a restaurant. She has already been working in these businesses for 13 years, and they are going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who supports her family. She belongs to the communal bank "Del Futuro del Manu" ["The Future of Manu"].

She needs this loan to buy merchandise like, for example, bags of rice, bags of sugar, mineral water, soft drinks and soda pop, noodles, cans of milk, and other things. She appreciates and values the loan and promises to meet the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store, like bags of rice, sugar, and other things.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Magene est secrétaire du collectif de crédit Zamiri. Jeune entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 5 enfants, qui étudient. Son conjoint offre de services de photocopie (Il est propriétaire d’une photocopieuse). La cliente est vendeuse des friperies. Elle s’installe au marché central de Virunga. Elle commença ses affaires avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 6 ans qu’elle fait ces petites spéculations. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter un ballon de friperies à marchander.  Dans le future, elle souhaiter accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants, construire et prendre soins de ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie grandement l’IMF Hekima pour son projet en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Magene, is the secretary of the loan collective Zamiri. A young energetic entrepreneur, she is 32 years old and the mother of five children, who are students. Her husband provides photocopying services. (He is the owner of a photocopier.) 

This client sells secondhand clothing. She is step up at the Virunga central market. She started her business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She made small speculations six years ago. This new loan will be used to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing to sell. 

For the future, she would like to grow her capital, educate her children, build [a house[, and take care of her children. And so, she thanks the MFI Hekima very much for its micro-loans for small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bety

texts.es:
Bety, de 40 años de edad , esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos, viven juntos en una casa propia en donde comparten sus días esforzándose mucho para que consigan una mejor calidad de vida.Bety se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi , tiene 2 vehículos que pudo comprar con los ahorros que iba juntando de otras actividades eventuales. Un mototaxi es conducido por su hijo mientras que el otro lo alquila a un chofer que diariamente llega a su vivienda para iniciar su labor. Al final del día recibe el pago establecido por la jornada de trabajo. Lleva trabajando en este negocio hace 5 años y lo hace sola ya que su conviviente se dedica a otras actividades. Comparte esta función con la venta ocasional de abarrotes.Su trabajo le permite realizar otras funciones en el día, comenta que no fue fácil emprender este trabajo ya que las dudas y los temores le embargaban porque no conocía sobre el funcionamiento de los vehículos y además no encontraba algún chofer confiable, pero poco a poco fue tomando empeño y ahora desarrolla su trabajo con mucha tranquilidad. Espera seguir alquilando sus vehículos, aumentar su flota y refaccionarlos para que funcionen mejor. 
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado arreglara el motor de un mototaxi que se encuentra en mal funcionamiento, con el monto restante renovará el tapizado de ambos vehículos.
texts.en:
Bety, 40, is married and has four children.  They all live together in a house of her own where they share their days striving much to attain a better quality of life.  Bety works leasing mototaxis.  She has two vehicles she was able to buy with savings she gradually amassed from occasional activities.  One of the mototaxis is driven by her son while the other is leased out to a driver who comes by her house to start work daily.  At the end of each day she receives the agreed-upon payment for the work day.  She’s been in this business for five years and does it alone since her spouse does other things.  She also sells groceries sometimes.

Her work makes it possible for her to do other things during the day.  She comments that it wasn’t easy to start this work because of the doubts and fears that assailed her because she didn’t know anything about how vehicles operated and she was unable to find a trustworthy driver too.  Gradually, though, she started to overcome this and now does her work very comfortably.  She hopes to continue leasing out her vehicles, to increase the size of her fleet and to repair them so that they will function better.

On this occasion, she will request 2,000 soles.  She’s very happy to know that she can count on having financial support because she’ll feel more sure about making progress with her business.  She will use the requested amount to repair the engine on one of the mototaxis that’s having mechanical problems.  With the left over she’ll reupholster both vehicles.

loans.use: to service her vehicles.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Grace decided to set up her own ‘Wakye’ selling business ('Wakye' is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice, and colored leaves). She prepares her ‘Wakye’ on her own and proceeds to sell it in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). With over  five years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited, due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help Grace purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye.’ She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a trader) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye.’

loans.name: Rabea

texts.en:
Rabea is 31 years old, married and has one child. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is hardworking man who strives to improve his living conditions. He is a bus driver. Most of the money he earns is spent on raising his child.

Rabea has a small house, which is very old and needs a quick renovation. He is requesting a loan for 200,000 YER, which he will use to buy construction supplies to use for his house. He hopes that after the completion of the renovation, he will feel safe in his house with his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the ingredients needed in her business. Her loan and income helped in their household expenditures as well in the education of her children. As a widow, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another PHP 12,000 loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Flora dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Segundo Alfredo

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Segundo no pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de mantenimiento y reparación de maquinaria pesada que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Segundo trabaja como obrero supervisor de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Segundo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que las paredes de su cocina se encuentran deterioradas y necesita tarrajearla, pintarla y ponerle piso, de esta manera Segundo y su familia contarán con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Segundo is a single 20-year-old man. He lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial, with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire for self-improvement. Segundo was unfortunately unable to do the heavy machinery maintenance and repair technical degree that he wanted to take, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity that he begin working at a very young age. 

In his spare time he likes to play soccer with his friends and sometimes cooks a delicious dish of "Arroz Chaufa" (Peruvian fried rice) to share with his family. At his own initiative, with a lot of hard work and dedication, Segundo works as a supervising field worker at an agricultural estate in his city. He works every day for about 10 hours and thinks that it is going well for him because of his good performance and the friendly way that he treats others. 

Segundo is very appreciative of Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to improve his home. The walls of his kitchen are damaged and need to be sealed and painted, and he needs to put in a floor. In this way, Segundo and his family will have better security and well-being. Segundo will continue to work and push himself to achieve his great dream of being able to study a professional degree.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria nació en la ciudad de Paruro y desde hace 28 años que radica en la ciudad de Salvación.  (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Flor de Maria tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella tiene un local donde atiende compromisos sociales como por ejemplo bautizos, matrimonios, cumpleaños y aniversarios. Ella también se dedica a la elaboración de refrescos y helados en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para insumos como por ejemplo colorantes, frutas, sacos de azúcar, tarros de leche  y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Flor de María was born in the city of Paruro but has lived in the city of Salvación for the last 28 years.  (The city of Salvación is located in Manu District in Manu Province within Madre de Dios Department, Peru).

Flor de María, 48, is married and her beautiful relationship has produced four children.  She has a locale where social events like baptisms, weddings, birthdays and anniversaries take place.  She also works making soft-drinks and ice-cream at home.  She’s been in these businesses for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She’s an enterprising, hardworking woman who moves her family forward for she belongs to the “Del Futuro del Manu” (Manu’s Future) communal bank.

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy ingredients like food coloring, fruit, and sacks of sugar, jugs of milk and other things.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like food coloring, fruit, sacks of sugar, jugs of milk, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Ama  Agens 2

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama Agnes 2 is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves).  She usually sells her ‘Wakye’ in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ for 8 years. Ama is married and has 8 children. Her husband works as a  farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Wakye’. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a widow and has 5 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Adjoa is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 5 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Adjoa  uses her income to provide for the entire family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa  plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Greziel

texts.en: Greziel is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 children from Panglao, Bohol. She runs and operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Greziel is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages. With this loan, she will be able to attract more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and profit. Greziel hopes to make her business a success and more profitable in the future. She also wants to save money so that she can support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages

loans.name: Ermilia Geovannya

texts.es: Ermilia una joven 25 años de edad, es casada se dedica a la agricultura, en la actualidad no tiene hijos, con su esposo está tratando de salir adelante para que cuando nazcan sus hijos no les falten nada, por lo que está solicitando este crédito para realizar mejoras a su vivienda, embaldosando su casa la cual le falta mucho que mejorar como paredes ventanas, puertas los que hará poco a poco ya que aun con el esfuerzo de los dos sus ingresos no le es suficiente para cubrir este gasto.
texts.en: Ermilia, 25, is a young, married woman who works in agriculture.  She doesn’t have any children at present.  She and her husband are trying to get ahead so that when they do have children they will lack nothing which is why she’s requesting this loan so she can do some home improvements.  She will seal the walls of the house.  She also very much needs to improve walls, windows and doors.  She will do this gradually because even with their two incomes and both their efforts it’s still not enough to cover this expense.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en esta misma ciudad. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Rocio tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora y vende. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo semillas secas para elaborar collares y pulseras. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rocío was born in the city of Salvación and still lives there.  (The city of Salvación is located in Manu District in Manu Province within Madre de Dios Department, Peru).
