Rocío, 36, is in a common law relationship and has a son.  Her main economic activity is crafts making.  She has a small workshop at home where she makes and sells them.  She’s been in this business for three years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She’s an enterprising, hardworking woman who moves her family forward because she belongs to the “Del Futuro del Manu” (Manu’s Future) communal bank.

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy work supplies like dry seeds, for example, to manufacture necklaces and bracelets.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like dry seeds.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat is 54 years old and is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and children. Her husband is a janitor in a hospital, but his salary is not enough to meet the household expenses. He wants to start his own business.
 
Jannat has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. Along with their savings and the loan amount, her husband will purchase a rickshaw. He plans to drive the rickshaw at night while keeping his present job. In this way, his monthly income will increase and they will be able to send their children to school.

Jannat is very hopeful for this loan, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba sells maize in Dompoase, near Cape Coast. She has been doing so for about two years. Aba is married and has six  children. She uses all of her income to support her husband, who is a farmer, in feeding and providing for her family. Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy inventory for her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 1,000 USD. Joanina is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Ekua sells maize in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. As a widow with six children, Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.  

Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. 

Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Cindy Elian

texts.es:
Cindy es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Cindy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cindy trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de ocho horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Cindy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de cañas y palos de madera, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder cercar la parte trasera de su hogar, ya que poco a poco están avanzando la construcción de esta, así pues Cindy y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, de esta manera ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada que proteja a su familia.
texts.en:
Cindy’s a 20-year-old woman living in the city of Cañete, Imperial District, with her husband and small son who she loves and is her reason for living.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person together with her husband focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Sadly, due to lack of economic resources and because she needed to start work at a very young age, Cindy was unable to study the professional career of Secretary like she’d wanted to.  In her free time she enjoys strolling along the welcoming streets in her city and on occasion cooks a delicious ‘Carapulcra con Sopa Seca’ to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Cindy works as a field hand at a local agricultural estate.  She works every day for about 8 hours and thinks she does well because of the good way she does her work and the kind way she treats others.

Cindy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy sugarcane stalks and wood sticks that will serve to fence in the rear of the house.  They are gradually advancing with home construction and Cindy and her family will be able to have increased security and well-being.  She will thus continue working toward attaining her greatest dream: to have a proper home that will shelter her family.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Jesus Raul

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre de 49 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jesus no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jesus se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra maíz morado, Jesus trabaja todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jesus se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, de esta manera Jesus espera lograr una buena cosecha, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su cosecha.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 49-year-old man who lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and their two children. He loves them and they are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. He and his spouse dedicate all of their efforts to helping their family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the fact that he needed to begin working at a very young age, Jesus couldn't study a professional degree.

In his spare time, he likes to distract himself by watching TV, and sometimes cooks a delicious dish of beans and meat to share with his family. At his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Jesus works in agriculture. He has a small piece of land where he plans purple corn. Jesus works every day in the fields and can work for approximately 8 hours. He thinks it is going well for him due to his experience and the friendly way in which he treats others.

Jesus is very appreciative of Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy manure and fertilizers for his farming. In this way, Jesus hopes to have a good harvest. He will continue to work and push himself to achieve his great dream of having a bigger harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 54 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in this business for over five years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. In the future, Esterlita wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is married and from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She sells fish and raises hogs, which she has been doing for more than 15 years.  

Isabel is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fish to sell in the market and feeds for the pigs. Isabel is optimistic that this loan will help her to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell and feeds for pigs

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Juana no pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Corte y Confección, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juana trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Juana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de plásticos y esteras, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder refacción el techado de su hogar, el mismo que se encuentra deteriorado y al acercarse la época de invierno necesita arreglarlo para que ella y su familia cuenten con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana, 51, lives in the city of Cañete, Imperial District, with her two children who she loves and are her main reason for living.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward since she’s both father and mother to her children.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start work at a very early age, Juana was unable to study the technical career of clothing design and clothes making.  In her free time she likes to cook delicious ‘Carapulcra con Sopa Seca’ to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Juana works as a field hand on a local agricultural estate.  She works every day for about 8 hours and thinks that she does well because of the good way she carries out her duties and the kind way she treats others.

Juana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy plastic and matting that will serve to roof the house.  The roof is currently in poor state and the winter  season is approaching so she needs to repair it so she and her family can have greater security and well-being.  She will thus continue working to reach her greatest dream: to finish building her house.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married to a farmer and has six children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She cooks rice and vegetable sauce to sell in Dompoase, near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years.  Aba uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the entire family. Aba  will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.name: Edison Ferney

texts.es: Edison de 18 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor y con ganas de un mejor futuro para el y su familia. Acaba de salir del colegio y debido a la difícil condición económica en su hogar, desde hace algunos meses comenzó a laborar para pagarse sus estudios universitarios. Trabaja en un cultivo de flores prestando el servicio de transporte hacia el aeropuerto en el municipio de Rionegro, Colombia. Debido a que el vehículo en el que transporta el producto presenta algunas fallas técnicas, Édison se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la  reparación del motor y amortiguadores. Espera con esta inversión mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Edison is 18 years old. He is a young entrepreneur and wants a better future for him and his family. He just finished school and owing to the difficult economic condition at home, some months ago began to work to pay for his university studies. 

He works in flower cultivation, providing transportation service to the airport in the town of Rionegro, Colombia. Owing to some technical failures in the vehicle in which he transports the product, Edison finds himself applying for a loan that he will invest in the repair of the motor and the shocks. He hopes with this investment to improve the economic condition of his family and to convert himself into a great professional.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle's motor and shocks.

loans.name: Angie Del Rosario

texts.es:
Angie es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y su pequeña hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para su hija; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Angie pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Farmacia, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver novelas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angie trabaja brindando atención al público en una farmacia de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Angie se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros, las cuales le servirán de mucho para poder iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, de esta manera Angie podrá contar con mayores ingresos económicos y seguirá trabajando para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Angie, 22, lives in the city of Ica with her parents and her little daughter, who she loves and gives her purpose in life. She is a very nice person, hard working and enthusiastic, who gives her all to providing her daughter a better life; thanks to her own efforts and the support of her parents, Angie was able to study Pharmacy. In her spare time, she enjoys watching soap operas and sometimes she makes a delicious ceviche to share with her family.
By her own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Angie works in a pharmacy in her city. She attends customers 8 hours a day, every day and she thinks it’s going well because of her determination and kindness toward everyone.
Angie is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they offer, which will allow her to buy men’s and women’s clothing so she can open her clothing sales business, and that way, she’ll be able to continue working and making more money so she can reach her goal of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 53-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and five children. For 25 years, her husband has been running a wood shop, which is the only source of income for their family. He is an excellent carpenter and he is skilled at making good quality furniture. 

Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in his business. Her husband will purchase a wood cutting machine and some tools like hammers, nails, wooden sheets, glue, etc. for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son. Parveen prays for her children's bright future and her husband's good health.

loans.use: To purchase a wood cutting machine and other tools

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: A 1,500 USD loan is offered to Jacinta to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee, as well as a refrigerator to keep drinks cold. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2009. She feels comfortable running her business and earning money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Elkin Dario

texts.es:
Elkin de 50 años de edad, laboró gran parte de su vida como independiente en la venta de comidas rápidas, pero desde hace 19 años, a raíz de un accidente perdió gran parte de la movilidad de sus piernas, por lo cual estuvo en recuperación por varios años. Hace 10 años, su madre le cedió un garaje de su propiedad e inició prestando el servicio de parqueadero para las chazas ambulantes.
Élkin asegura que este trabajo se ha convertido en una gran bendición, debido a que puede trabajar sin ningún problema con su limitación. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una cortina para el garaje ya que la que posee actualmente se encuentra en malas condiciones, lo que le permitirá brindarles más seguridad a sus clientes y mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Elkin, 50 years old, worked for a large part of his life as a fast-food vendor. However, he lost a large part of the mobility in his legs 19 years ago due to an accident, so he was in recovery for many years. 10 years ago, his mother bequeathed him a garage and Elkin began offering his services parking street vendor carts. Elkin says this job has turned out to be a great blessing because he can work without any problems arising from his physical limitations.

Today he is asking for a loan which he will use to buy a curtain for the garage, since the one that he has right now is in poor condition. The new curtain will allow him to provide better security for his customers and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a curtain for his garage

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
This is Rehema. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more tailoring items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for Kshs 45,000  to buy more materials for making dresses: zips, buttons and thread. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making dresses: zips, buttons and thread.

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en:
Bayanmunkh is 39 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Bayanmunkh has been providing transportation services to local people for ten years and he usually picks up his customers at an outdoor market. His wife makes and sells traditional Mongolian clothes to vendors at wholesale prices. Before this work, his wife was working as a saleswoman at a private business. Bayanmunkh's eldest daughter is an eleventh-grade student in high school. 

The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repairs, such as replacing the roof, windows, and floors. So Bayanmunkh is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass, and foam. Using these materials, he can repair and insulate his house, providing a warmer and more comfortable home for his family. The importance of renovating the house is that it will enable the family to burn less coal, release less carbon dioxide, and contribute to the efforts to reduce air pollution. Bayanmunkh is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jewelry, clothing, bags, and display cases.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida, 57, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She has children and they manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Aida operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug makers come up every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Aida's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Aida is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items for her business.

Aida dreams of having another place for her business and hopes to support her children financially. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Aba did not have access to any formal education. Yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba prepares and sells ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made with fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish paste) in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about seven years. As a widow with seven children, Aba uses all her income to provide for her family. 

Aba will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and cassava, which will help her in improving her overall ‘Banku’ sales.  Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and cassava, which will help her in improving her overall ‘Banku’ sales.

loans.name: Ma. Carmen

texts.en: Ma. Carmen is 54 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business making nipa huts to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than four years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She has been with GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 16,500 PHP to purchase raw materials for making nipa huts. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making nipa hut

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 57 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural business, raising cows in the Philippines. Clara has been raising cows for 14 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

Clara requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her cow. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cow.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 45-year-old married woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in snack food selling for more than 11 years now. This is the source of her income. She also wants to invest in a hog raising business.

As of now, Anecita lacks the financial resources for the expansion of her ventures. She joined CEVI to gain access to loan services offered by the organization to micro-entrepreneurs like her. She is requesting a loan to buy more snack foods to sell in her neighborhood and piglets to raise. 
Anecita dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell in her neighborhood and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married to a driver and has six children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She cooks rice and vegetable sauce for sale in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. Ama uses her income to assist her husband to provide for the entire family. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice, fish, and other ingredients to prepare her food, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice, fish, and other ingredients to prepare her food, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en:
Mukhtiar is 37 years old, a hard-working and diligent woman. She has six children and her husband is working in a wood shop.

Mukhtiar has done various beautician courses and she is an excellent beautician by profession. She has been running her own beauty salon for six years. She is very skilled and an independent woman and she is helping her husband by running her own business. She spends all of her income generated from the business on the education of their children so that they can have a bright future.

Currently she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to expand her business by adding some more space to her salon. Her clients are increasing day by day and her current space is too congested so she would like to build one more room. She would also purchase some cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial scrubs, etc. and also some hair dryers. This loan could help her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon business by adding some more space to her salon

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a widow with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is  food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday used the previous loan to buy mattresses to sell. He is a 30-year-old, hard-working man, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Five years ago, he decided to venture into a clothing business in order to raise income for the family. He started his business with one million shillings and now he has four million. Price fluctuations and high fuel and transportation costs are his major challenges while his dream is to trade in wholesale. 

Monday intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 28-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and two children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2007, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business as the demand of his clients is increasing day by day. Therefore his wife Sadia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's store. 

Sadia's husband will purchase a variety of products including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses (lentils), detergents, oils, etc. to cope with the increasing demand of clients. Sadia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her husband's general store

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en: Francisca is 23 years and she is married and has four children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better now that she has applied for her first loan of $700. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as petrol & diesel. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy petrol & diesel for resale

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She is a mother of three children. She owns a small embroidery business in her house. Her embroidered clothes are liked by everyone.

Presently, her stock of embroidery materials is almost finished. Therefore, she is interested in purchasing a variety of embroidery materials, including colorful thread, beads, stones, needles and clothes. For that purpose, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is hoping that the loan will be a productive one for her business. With the profit amount, she wants to construct her own house. She hopes that she will earn sufficient profit so that she could easily pay back the loan, as well as construct her house. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan, because this will help her to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Atse

texts.en:
Atse is a widow and has children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated an open-air food business, cooking French fries and selling them to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate her business. She dreams of establishing a café as her business.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of potatoes and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of potatoes and cooking fat.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en esta misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Elizabeth tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. Ella trabaja en la municipalidad del Manu en el área de gerencia como asistenta de gerencia. También, ella trabaja vendiendo madera a diferentes compradores que vienen a la ciudad de Salvación. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth was born in the city of Salvación and still lives there.  (The city of Salvación is located in Manu District in Manu Province within the Madre de Dios Department, Peru).

Elizabeth is 26-years-old, single and has no children yet.  She works in the town of Manu as an assistant in the management department.  She also works selling lumber to various buyers who come to the city of Salvación.  She’s been in this business for three years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  She’s an enterprising, very hardworking woman who moves her family forward since she belongs to the “Del Futuro del Manu” (Manu’s Future) communal bank.  

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more lumber.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more lumber.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Reynaldo Santiago

texts.es:
El joven Reynaldo vive en la capital trabaja como colector de impuestos en un mercado  de la cuidad.
Soltero actualmente está  estudiando en la universidad y habita en la casa de sus padres.

Reynaldo está solicitando un crédito para realizar algunas  mejoras de construcción en la casa de sus  padres ya que lo  considera necesario para darles un techo digno y seguro  a sus progenitores
texts.en:
Reynaldo lives in the capital and works as a tax collector in a market in the city. He is single. Currently, he is studying at university and lives in his parents' home.

Reynaldo is asking for this loan to make some improvements to his parents home, as he considers it necessary to give them a proper, safe roof.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction.

loans.name: Otgonchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgonchimeg, 32 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional 'ger' (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She has been working as a waitress at a private business entity for four years. Her husband is employed as a carpenter by a wooden products sales company. Her elder son studies at high school while her younger son is at kindergarten. 

During winter time the family are chilled to the core due to living in an old deteriorated Mongolian traditional 'ger'. So this year, they began building their own house but couldn't finish it due to lack of finances. So Otgonchimeg is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, bricks, cement and metal shakes. If she can complete her house, their children can live in a comfortable and warm place. The high quality house will enable the family to burn less coal, releasing less carbon dioxide and thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. Living in a house is way better than living in a 'ger' in terms of both warmth and comfort. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who doesn't want her husband and sons to be chilled to the core in harsh wintertime.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is a kind and honest lady. She is 48 years old, and she belongs to Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for their family. They belong to a poor family and are going through a very difficult time. Her husband wants to grow his business, so that he can increase his income and savings. 

Shahida is a member of a seven-person borrowing group that has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan funds, Shahida will purchase a variety of fruits for her husband's business, such as mangoes, apples and bananas. She is hoping that the loan will be very helpful for the growth of the fruit shop business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to resell.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Rómulo nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en esta misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Rómulo tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. Él es técnico en contabilidad y trabaja en la sub región del departamento de Madre de Dios en el área de contabilidad, También, él y su esposa tienen una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde expenden diferentes comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, detergentes, pan, frutas, papeles y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería al por mayor como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, cajas de tarros de leches, bolsas de detergentes y etc.  Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rómulo was born in the city of Salvación and still lives there.  (The city of Salvación is located in Manu District in Manu Province within the Madre de Dios Department, Peru).

Rómulo is 38-years-old, married and this beautiful relationship has produced two children.  He’s an accounting technician and works in the sub-region of Madre de Dios  Department in the accounting department.  He and his wife also have a small grocery store where they sell various food items like rice, sugar, noodles, soft-drinks, detergent, bread, fruit, paper goods, etc.  He's been in this business for several years now and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it.  He belongs to the “Del Futuro del Manu” (Manu’s Future) communal bank.  

On this occasion he needs the loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale like sacks of rice, cases of jugs of milk, bags of detergent, etc.  He is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like sacks of rice, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba y desde hace 30 años que radica en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Fortunato tiene 52 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Él  trabaja como empleada pública y en sus horas libres se dedica a la tienda de abarrotes y al hospedaje. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Desde hace varios pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Fortunato was born in the city of Quillabamba and has resided in the city of Salvación for 30 years. (Salvación is located in the district of Manu, in the province of Manu in the region of Madre de Dios, Peru.)

Fortunato is 52 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which he has three children. He works in the public service and in his free time he works in his grocery store and lodge. It has already been many years since he started working in this business and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. For many years, he has belonged to the communal bank "Del Futuro del Manu" ["The Future of Manu"]. He needs this loan to buy merchandise such as, for example, bags of rice, bags of sugar, and other things. He appreciates and values the loan and promises to meet his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like bags of rice, bags of sugar, and other things.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Yaa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling foodstuffs and cooking ingredients, in Esuakyire (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Yaa is married and has four children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses.

Yaa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell a greater quantity of foodstuffs and cooking ingredients. In the long term, Yaa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, which will help her to expand and meet the rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of foodstuffs and cooking ingredients to resell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: A $1,000 US loan has been offered to Filomena, to improve her business. She has a kiosk, where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2009. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy some additional inventory, including biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee, and a refrigerator for cooling drinks to sell

loans.name: Dania María

texts.es:
La joven Dania María es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, soltera, se graduó como Licenciada en ciencias de la educación, gracias al esfuerzo de su padre hoy es una joven de buenos principios que se preparó profesionalmente aun con grandes sacrificios y bajo pobreza pero con deseo de superación logró culminar su carrera que le ha ayudado a tener un mejor nivel de vida.

Hoy labora como maestra de secundaria donde imparte la materia de Español y es algo que le gusta hacer con dedicación porque además es el trabajo que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y cuidar de su padre a quien le debe mucho.

Está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para pagar el arancel de la universidad, ya que está estudiando otra carrera universitaria con el fin de tener un mejor curriculum y con esto un mejor desarrollo económico.

Espera y confía en Dios para tocar los corazones de los inversionistas de Kiva para que aprueben su solicitud y llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en: Young Dania María comes from the town of El Sauce. She is single and has a Bachelor's degree in Education. Thanks to her father's efforts, despite their poverty, and at the cost of great sacrifices, she was able to study in order to have a profession. This young woman of strong moral principles is very keen on doing her best, which is why she managed to graduate and now enjoys a better standard of living. She teaches Spanish in a secondary school. She loves her job, and she loves to do it well, all the more so because her livelihood depends on it and it helps her take care of her father, to whom she owes a great debt. Dania María asks field partner Ceprodel for a loan in order to pay for her university fees, since she decided to enrol in order to get a second diploma to have a better curriculum vitae and improve her economic standing. She hopes and trusts in God that her story will inspire Kiva lenders to help her invest in her future.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado y vive con la  esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de cafe que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old, is married, and lives with his wife.  He wants this loan for purchasing fertilizer and to tend to a coffee plantation that they want to start.  He wants to give adequate upkeep to the crop so that he can have greater yield and thus have a higher income.

In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy inputs.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin Antonio de 57  años de edad, padres solteros con tres hijos de 22, 20, 13 de los cuales los dos menores están bajo su responsabilidad y están estudiando. El es originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lamentablemente no puedo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económico, se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos de la casa, lo cual lo hace lucha día a día para brindarles a sus hijo un futuro mejor, y poder ver realizado su sueño como es  que coronen una carrera universitaria.

Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos, como aceite,azucar, arroz, frijoles, cereales, jabon, detergentes, soya actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante, el dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Marvin Antonio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Marvin Antonio, 57, is a single father of three children who are 22, 20 and 13 years of age.  The two younger ones are still in his care and attending school.  He’s from León, a place located in the western part of the country.  Sadly, he was unable to study a university career due to the lack of economic resources.  He was forced to start working at a very young age to help with household expenses.  He strives daily to provide his children with a better future and to see him dream become reality: that they complete university.

Thanks to his enterprising spirit and his drive to get ahead, his economic activity is selling basic grains, oil, sugar, rice, beans, cereals, soap, detergent, soya, etc. from place to place.  He spends about 10 hours daily in this business and does so happily.  

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital to stock his business so that in the not too distant future he will be able to earn higher income.  Marvin Antonio is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Bebian

texts.en: Bebian is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Bebian is married and has two children. To make a living, Bebian sells fish in the local community. She has been in fish vending for five years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Bebian joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Shehla

texts.en:
Shehla, 34 years old, is a responsible mother of two children, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a government employee, and both of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household's needs including the educational expenses of their children, and they are facing many hurdles in life.

Shehla has been helping her husband, by operating a clothing sales business, in her house, for three years. Now she has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. The main purpose of the loan is to open a small boutique shop in the main market, because she would get more customers there. She would also buy a new variety of clothing, to attract more customers. She would save some money from the profit amount and pay the educational expenses of her children. She has a bright vision, and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To open a boutique and buy some additional inventory

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and widowed. She has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business, raising pigs for sale, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 4,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2007. Now, she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feed for the pigs. Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en: Calixta is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has been engaged in a t-shirt printing business for more than six years. This is her source of income. Calixta is asking for a loan to buy materials for t-shirt printing like frames, paint, screens, etc. Through this loan, she will be able to accept more t-shirt orders from her customers and clients. In the future, Calixta dreams of making her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy materials for shirt printing like frames, paint, screens, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene la edad de 65 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos y vive con la esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que Juan se financia con FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan, 65, has three children and lives with his wife.  He needs the loan to buy livestock to raise so that when it grows they can be sold and profits earned.  The livestock business will help him and his family to move forward.

This is the first time Juan has financed himself with Fudecosur.  He states that the credit committee has helped him quite a bit and he’s gotten good terms.  He hopes to grow with this project and to reach his objectives so that he can provide his family with improved quality of life and better economic stability in future.

This is his first loan from Fudecosur. He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Yerlin José

texts.es:
Yerlin José es un joven de 28 años, originario del municipio de El Sauce, a cargo solamente de su esposa, se dedica a laborar como guarda de seguridad en una empresa de dicho municipio y a pesar de ganar tan poco realiza su labor con dedicación y responsabilidad, ya que este oficio le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Yerlin como todo joven sueña con tener una familia con hijos y una casa con todas las condiciones adecuadas pero con lo poco que gana solamente le alcanza para el sustento de su hogar.

En este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para mejorar la salud de su esposa ya que se ha sentido mal por lo que lo está solicitando en Ceprodel para la compra de medicamentos y realización de ultrasonidos.

Pide a Dios y a los inversionistas de Kiva para que le apoyen con esta solicitud y con esto que mejore la salud de su esposa, ya que estos financiamientos son de gran ayuda para las personas de escasos recursos que muchas veces no tienen para cubrir estos gastos necesarios.
texts.en:
Yerlin José, 28, is a young man from the town of El Sauce; his wife is his only dependent.  He works as a security guard for a firm in said town and despite earning very little he does his work with dedication and responsibly since this job makes it possible for him to provide daily bread for his home.

Yerlin, like all young men, dreams with having a family with children and a house with all adequate living conditions but with the little  he earns he’s only able to barely support his home.

He currently needs a loan to improve his wife’s health because she’s been feeling poorly which is why he’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy medicine and to pay for an ultrasound.

He asks God and Kiva lenders to support his loan application so that his wife’s health may improve because these loans are of great help for people of scarce resources who very often don’t’ have enough to cover these necessary costs.

loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for an ultrasound.

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Усмону 35 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Дети учатся в школе. Усмон со своей семьей проживает в районе Дж.Руми. У него среднее образование. Он занимается растениеводством уже 7 лет. У него имеется 2 га орошаемой земли, на котором он выращивает пшеницу, арбуз и рис. Одновремнно Усмон занимается и животноводством. Жена помогает ему в ведении сельского хозяйства. Сейчас Усмон нуждается в кредите для обработки земли. С этим намерением он просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая пшеницы, арбуза и риса, а на оставшуюся часть кредита он намерен закупить мелкорогатый скот. За счет прибыли Усмон хочет провести обряд обрезания своего младшего сына.
texts.en: Usmon is 35 years old.  He is married and a father of three children.  His children attend a school.  Usmon and his family live in the J. Rumy district.  He has a secondary education.  He has been involved in agriculture for 7 years.  He has 2 hectares of irrigated land, where he grows wheat, watermelons and rice.  Concurrently, Usmon is involved in animal husbandry.  His wife helps him with running the agricultural business.  Now Usmon needs a loan to treat the land.  With this intent, he is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for the wheat, watermelon and rice crops and plans to use the remainder of the loan to buy small livestock.  Usmon wants to use the profit to hold a circumcision ceremony for his youngest son.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and small livestock

loans.name: Fazlidin

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Фазлидин. Ему 25 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2  детей. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более 6  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Он так хорошо ухаживает за своим скотом, словно знает и понимает язык своего скота. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки скота. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This kind person, who always tries to improve his living conditions and hopes for a bright future, needs financial support.  His name is Fazlidin.  He is 25 years old, married and raising 2 children.  Because he lives in a rural area, he has a good opportunity to develop his animal husbandry business.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years and has an extensive experience in this business field.  He takes such good care of his livestock that it seems that he knows and understands his livestock's language.  Thanks to the good condition of the livestock, he has regular clients.  He wants to develop the business and earn more income.  Fazlidin is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni to purchase livestock.  He plans to use the profit to improve his living conditions.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and develop his business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a fish monger at Esuekyire, near Cape Coast. She sells smoked fish. Adjoa has been in this business for six years, now. She is married to a farmer and has five children. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profit, Adjoa wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish, which she will smoke and sell

loans.name: Las Magníficas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MAGNÍFICAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: kiosco de dulces, venta de refrescos, venta de detergentes, tienda de barrio, macramé de mantas, venta de cotillones, venta de cosméticos, venta de ganado, venta de joyas, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de batidos; mismo que inicia hace años atrás por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The "Las Magnificas" communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with the organization Pro Mujer. They are working with one of the organization's regional offices in Collpani. The group is made up of six members and led by a board of directors headed by Veronica as President. The members of the bank run a variety of businesses, including among them: a candy stand, soft drink sales, detergent sales, a neighbourhood store, blanket embroidery, sales of small toys, sales of cosmetics, livestock sales, jewelry sales, and grocery sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses where Veronica is a member. She says that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer. She joined the group at the invitation of a consultant from the institution, who came to visit her at her home. Currently, Veronica has a business selling milkshakes; she began this business on her own initiative years ago.  

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is married and has been blessed with seven, school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past ten years, he has operated a dairy farming business, selling at retail and at the market, to his neighbors and to restaurant operators. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of adding more dairy cows and expanding to a motorcycle business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, he wants to start a motorcycle transport business. He has some savings, and he will add the loan to that and purchase a motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to add to his savings and have enough to purchase a motorcycle, which he will use to start up a motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Diana Cristina

texts.es:
Diana de 29 años de edad se ha caracterizado en su barrio por ser una mujer luchadora, por su condición de madre soltera le ha tocado enfrentarse a muchas dificultades y laborar en diferentes oficios. Trabajó como empleada del servicio doméstico, pero debido a que no tenía con quien dejar a sus dos hijos se vio en la obligación de retirarse. 
Con la ayuda de su madre, logró montar una tienda en su casa, con la cual genera los recursos para la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos.
Su mayor sueño es ver su tienda como una de las cotizadas del sector, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito, que destinará para la compra de surtido con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Diana, 29, is known in her neighborhood as a fighter because as a single mother she has been up against many challenges and has had many different jobs. She was a domestic worker, but had to give up her job as she couldn’t find anyone to care for her two children.
With her mother’s help, she was able to open a store in her home, which generates enough income to feed and educate her children.
Her dream is to see her store become the most popular in the area, and for that, she is requesting a loan to stock up her store in order to increase sales and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic products for her store.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 60 years old. He lives in Naghobilevi village, Ozurgeti district, with his 56-year-old wife. Teimuraz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family runs an agricultural business. They own a plot of land where mandarins, nut trees and maize are grown. All the harvested products are sold locally at the markets. The family receives additional income, i.e., a salary earned by Teimuraz’s wife. She is teaching foreign languages (English and German).

Recently, Teimuraz requested a loan from Credo, to start up a family business. Teimuraz has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, Teimuraz will open a wine cellar. He will purchase wine at the wholesale price, and resell it with a price markup from the commercial space that he already owns.  As Teimuraz will not have to pay rent for the space, and he will be selling wine himself from the shop, the profit will be significant. This will make the business successful, and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To open a wine cellar

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 36-year-old, married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is the mother of four children. Elisa has been engaged in a basket-making business for more than 20 years. Elisa works hard to earn a living, so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the schooling of their children.

Elisa is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket-making, like rattan (a native palm), bamboo, straw and others. With this increased quantity of materials, she will be able to weave more baskets and sell them to the market. Elisa has hopes of making her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket-making, like rattan, bamboo, straw and others

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina has been offered a $600 loan to improve her business of selling petrol. Many people come to buy petrol from her every day. With the loan, Celina will buy some additional supplies, such as petrol and diesel. She has been involved in this business since 2011. She is comfortable running her business because she is able to earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy petrol and diesel.

loans.name: Dora Amparo

texts.es:
Dora de 36 años de edad, considera que su mayor prioridad como madre es velar por el cuidado y bienestar de sus dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad,
Desde hace 15 años labora en el sector de la confección, trabajó en varias empresas del sector en donde adquirió la experiencia que hoy ha utilizado en la creación de su propio taller. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de comprar tela para confeccionar pijamas y bóxer para hombres y niños, con el fin de aprovechar el alto nivel de demanda.
Su mayor deseo es expandir su negocio y convertirse en una fuente de empleo permanente para las mujeres cabeza de familia.
texts.en:
Dora, 36, believes that her main priority as a mother is to provide care and well-being for her two children aged 16 and 10.
For the last 15 years she has worked in the sewing sector. She’s worked in various companies where she acquired the skill and experience she uses today in her own workshop.
She is asking for a loan to buy fabric in order to make pajamas and boxers for men and boys, as they are in high demand.
Her dream is to expand her business so it will become a source of fulltime income for female heads of families.

loans.use: buy fabric.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en: Elvisa is a 45 year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has been engaged in the nipa weaving business for more than three years now. She is also in the food vending business. Elvisa is asking for a loan to buy materials for nipa weaving, like nipa palm, straw and others and additional ingredients for food vending. In the future, Elvisa hopes to expand her business and make it a success. Moreover, she hopes to experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for nipa weaving like nipa palm, straw and others and additional ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en:
Kaingu is a married man with nine children, one of whom still attends school. He lives at his own house which has neither electricity nor piped water.  He has operated a retail shop business for more than twenty years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase on credit.

With the loan that he is requesting he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay workers who are preparing land for the next planting season.

loans.name: Jamaa

texts.en:
Jamaa, aged 22 years, is a married man with one child who is still young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, where his potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season it becomes hard to operate. His dream is take another loan from Yehu and build his permanent home. 

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu because of affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida is 60 years old. She lives in Kurdghelauri village, Telavi district, with her 62 year-old husband, Tariel.  Zinaida requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
Zinaida is trading clothes. She buys from Turkey at the wholesale price, brings it to her district and sells with the price mark up among her villagers. The family's additional income is Tariel’s monthly salary. He is working at the children's boarding house as a security guard.
Zinaida requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Zinaida has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Zinaida will open a Georgian bread bakery. She owns a commercial place, where she already has started renovation jobs and needs the loan to finish it and purchase all the needed equipment. The bread will be sold straight from the bakery which is located at a populous area. This business will increase the family income and Zinaida will be able improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: To open a Georgian bread bakery

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Christina is a married woman in her early 60s with four children (three of them in school). She has been managing her family by running a food shop selling different food items. She has been in this business since 2011. She is doing fine in her project and family as well. She works from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This will be Christina's 16th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully, she managed to increase the foods she sells to meet her customers' demands and bought a wheelbarrow for luggage carrying. With the profit earned, she bought a plot of land, where she expects to build a house, and paid school fees and home expenses. She will use this loan to replenish the food inventory in her retail shop. She dreams of building a nice house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Kichangani," which totals 20 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to replenish the inventory in her retail food shop.

loans.name: Teofilo Jose

texts.es: Don Teófilo, de 37 años de edad es casado, tiene 4 hijos por quienes vela para su bienestar en la vida, el Sr. Teófilo se dedica a la Molienda de Oro en las minas, el solicita este crédito para cambiar la tabla del taller donde realiza las molienda, las cuales se encuentran en mal estado y se aproxima el invierno por lo que necesita ir mejorando esa parte, de esta manera pretende garantizar el buen desempeño en su labor para ganarse el pan de cada día, siendo su prioridad el bienestar de la familia y mantenerse con buena salud, para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 37, is married and has four children who he cares for. 

Teófilo works grinding gold in the mines. He is requesting this loan so he can change the grinding table in his workshop. 

It is in bad shape and winter is nearing so he needs to improve this part. 

This way he can guarantee good results with his work in order to earn his daily bread. 

His priority is the well begin of his family and to stay healthy so he can work.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 46-year-old married woman from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari, or variety, store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Lorna needs a loan for the expansion of her store. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, seasonings, soap, and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, seasonings, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es:
Daniel nació en la ciudad de Puno y desde hace 17 años que radica en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Daniel tiene 47 años de edad y está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Él es Ingeniero Civil y trabaja de forma independiente, él tiene una pequeña oficina de consultoría de Ingeniería donde se realizan por ejemplo planos para construcciones y otras cosas más. Desde hace varios pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y en esta oportunidad Daniel requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de escritorio como cuadernos, papel, lapiceros, planos, tintes, y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Daniel was born in the city of Puno and has been living in the city of Salvación for the past 17 years. 

Salvación is located in the Manu district in the province of Manu in the Madre de Dios region. 

Daniel, 47, is married and has two children from this union. He is a civil engineer and is self employed. 

He has a small engineering office where he make plans for buildings and other things. 

For a while he has been a member of to the “Del Futuro del Manu” community bank. At this time Daniel is asking for a loan to buy stationery supplies such as notebooks, paper, pencils, maps, ink and other products.

He appreciates and values the loan and is committed to make the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies such as notebooks, paper, pencils, maps, ink and other products.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Anina

texts.en: Anina is 28 years and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better since she applied for her first loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as soft drinks, hard drinks, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator to keep drinks and biscuits in. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator to keep drinks and biscuits in

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana earns a living through her hog raising business. She lives with her family in the town of Cortes, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than five years now. Emeliana also sells snack foods to the people in her place. 

Emeliana is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs and additional ingredients for her food vending like flour, sugar and milk. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

 Emeliana has hopes of saving money to reinvest in the same ventures and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs and additional ingredients for her food vending like flour, sugar and milk

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.en:
Abdulhakim is a 31-year-old married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store. He has three years of experience in this business and therefore has a great deal of knowledge about the market and the demands of customers. He is a very successful entrepreneur. He started with a small working capital to open his business. He is the sole source of income for his family. 

Abdulhakim applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to purchase more grocery products to satisfy his customers' demand. He hopes to expand his business more so that his profit will increase.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to satisfy his customers' demand.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods to the people in her place, Tagbilaran, Bohol. Luz is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and seasonings, soap and toiletries, sodas and beverages. In this way, she will be able to improve and cater for more buyers in her store. Luz has hopes of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue which is needed for their expenses and daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and seasonings, soap and toiletries, sodas and beverages

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 21 years old and she is married. She has a business selling bricks to generate income for her family.
