She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan of $ 1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as cement, sand, and tools to make bricks. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and tools to make bricks.

loans.name: Maryselyn

texts.en:
Maryselyn is a 37-year-old woman from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Maryselyn is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, biscuits, snack foods, soda, and other beverages. Through this loan, she will be able to sell more, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, biscuits, snack foods, soda, and other beverages.

loans.name: Donara

texts.en:
Donara is from Qarakert village, Armavir region. She has been working at a local clinic as a nurse for many years. As her salary is hardly enough for covering her family's daily costs, Donara also is involved in agriculture. She keeps two cows and cultivates tomatoes, eggplants, cucumbers and cabbages. Donara works hard to gather a good harvest and sustain her family of six: Donara herself, her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. 

As agriculture helps Donara and her family to have a stable income during the year, Donara would like to expand her farming business. She has applied to SEF International for this loan to purchase four pigs, an ox, and forage for feeding them. The loan is very important for Donara to gather more agricultural income and sustain a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for four pigs, an ox, and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is a small-scale grocer in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has had some formal education as he is a Junior High School graduate. He is married and has six children. His wife is a trader.

 Kofi has been working as a grocer for close to four years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to purchase an increased quantity of groceries to sell, thus allowing him to meet rising customers’ demand. He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to fulfill his dream of buying a grocery stand, hence helping him sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is 48 years old. He lives in the small village of Senaki District with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, grandson and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Anzor requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 milking cows, 2 calves, 2 horses, a pig and 2 piglets. They produce cheese and sell it as well as the piglets locally. Besides this, they have a 1.5 hectare plot of agricultural land.  It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Anzor requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Anzor has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Anzor will begin buy and sell calves. He plans to purchase calves and resell after few months at a higher price. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves for resale

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza del Carmen es una mujer de 39 años, madre soltera de dos hijos menores en edad escolar. A pesar de ser madre soltera ha tratado de darle lo mejor a sus hijos, ha luchado por sacarlos adelante y dotarlos de buenos principios, de educación.

Se desempeña como Administradora en una Institución del mismo municipio, profesión que le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda donde hoy le brinda a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Sueña con ver preparados a sus dos hijos para que en un futuro se defiendan solos en la vida.

En este momento está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para mejorar su salud ya que se ha sentido mal con el cual piensa pagar consultas médicas y compra de medicina, ya que la salud es la primera riqueza de la vida, para rendir mejor en su trabajo y que sus hijos la tengan por largos años con la ayuda de Dios.

Se siente muy agradecida con Kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado durante estos años y los créditos que la han financiado los cuales le han ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza del Carmen is a 39-year-old, single mother of two minor children who are school-age.  Despite being a single mother she’s tried to give her children the best; she’s striven to move them forward instilling them with good values and education.

She works as an administrator in an institution in the same town, a profession that’s made it possible for her to improve her home’s conditions where today she’s able to provide better living conditions for her family.  She dreams with seeing her two children prepared so that they can fend for themselves in life in future.

At present, she’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to improve her health since she’s been feeling poorly and she plans to use it to pay for medical consultations and to buy medicine since health is life’s main wealth in order to work well and so that her children will have her for long years to come with God’s help.

She feels very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they have provided her with during these years and for the loans they’ve financed that have helped her improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for medical consultations and for medicine.

loans.name: Tauro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TAURO” iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de ropa, costura de poleras, costura de colchas y enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió desde su niñez y ya tiene cuarenta años de trabajo en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clientela. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “TAURO” lending group will start its fifteenth cycyle at Pro Mujer as a part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. They are made up of eight members and are headed by a board where Martha is the President. 

The members of the communal group have different business such as:  neighborhood store, selling fruit, selling food, selling clothes, sewing t-shirts, sewing quilts and skirts. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners where Martha is a member. 

She mentions that seven years ago she became a member of Pro Mujer through the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. 

Currently she has a business selling fabric and blankets. She learnt this business in her childhood and has worked in this field for forty years. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase capital (buy wool) which she will buy in the markets in the city of El Alto and then she will fill orders from her clients. 

This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her house as she is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the areas of health and loans. 

.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Concepción De María

texts.es:
La señora concepción vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como bibliotecaria en una universidad de Managua casada con 4 hijos a su cargo en edad escolar.

doña concepción está solicitando un crédito para gastos médicos y compra de medicamentos.

La señora también manifiesta su agradecimiento  hacia kiva y ceprodel ya que en el crédito anterior lo utilizo para mejorar su vivienda para darle mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Concepción lives in the city of Managua and works as a librarian in one of Managua’s universities; she’s married and has four school-age children in her care.  She’s asking for a loan to pay for medical expenses and to buy medicine.  She states her gratitude to Kiva and Ceprodel because she used her previous loan to do some home improvements providing more comfort for her family.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Antonio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja desde hace 8 años  en una universidad de Managua se caracteriza por ser un joven muy responsable con su trabajo  y su mayor esfuerzo lo hace para el bienestar de sus familia.

Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento bloques, hierro. Y pago de mano de obra.

 para hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda para darle mayor seguridad a su familia.
Manuel está muy agradecido con kiva ceprodel porque gracias a los crédito que se le han otorgado ha mejorado   su vivienda  y su condición de vida
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio lives in the city of Managua and has worked for the last 8 years for a university in Managua; he’s noted for being a young man who is very responsible at work.  He makes his greatest effort for his family’s well-being.  

He’s requesting a loan to buy building supplies like cement, concrete blocks and iron rods and to pay labor costs to do some home improvements in order to provide his family with increased security.

Manuel is very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel because thanks to the granted loan he has succeeded in improving his home and his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages two and six years old. She describes herself as determined. 

Janet operates a beauty salon where she offers cosmetic hair treatments to women. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with many customers, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as power breakdowns.

Janet will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cosmetics and hair products. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair products

loans.name: Chiboga

texts.en: For the last several years, Chiboga has earned a living by selling fish to neighbors and passersby by going door to door, Her main challenge is the seasonality of supply in her business. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 49,610 to buy more fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Don José es una persona responsable y amable, muy laborioso y no posee vicios, su grupo familiar es grande pues posee 6 miembros su esposa y sus 5 hijos, viven en casa propia, Él se dedica al cultivo de cereales maíz y maicillo además a la cría de cerdos criollos y devenga un dinero adicional por trabajar de jornale en la zona, Don Jose solicita credito porque en esta oportunidad cultivara 2 manzanas de maíz por lo que comprara insumos agrícolas como abonos semillas de maiz, fertilizantes, herbicidas entre otras cosas necesarias para su siembra y tambien poder mejorar la tierra donde va a sembrar que es la que muestra en la fotografia y asi el pueda tener un buen cultivo para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
José is a responsible, kind person who works hard and has no vices.  His family group is large for it includes six members: his wife and five children.  They live in a house they own.  He works growing cereals like corn and sorghum and he also raises pigs.  He earns extra income working as a day laborer in the zone.  

José is asking for the loan because on this occasion he will plant two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of corn and to do so will buy farm supplies like corn seeds, fertilizer and herbicide, among other things needed for the crops; he will also make improvements to the land where he’s going to plant and which is shown in the photograph so that he can obtain a good crop yield and higher profits to give his family all they need with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana de 31 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad viven en casa propia, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y maicillo tambien a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña Ana solicita un credito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, entre otras cosa tambien para el mejoramiento del terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotigrafia  para obtener un mejor cultivo  y tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia
texts.en:
Ana, 31, lives with her life companion and their two children who are 2 and 6 years of age; they live in a house they own.  She works in agriculture growing corn and sorghum and she also raises pigs and barnyard fowl.   She uses profits obtained to cover some of her household expenses.  

Ana’s asking for a loan to buy manure, seeds and fertilizer, among other things and also to improve the land where she’ll plant that’s shown in the photograph so that she can get better crops and attain better economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es: Don Daniel de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres y su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y maicillo, simbra hortalizas y tambien tiene crianza de pollos; con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, él desea mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra en la foto y poder comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos por eso Don Daniel solicita un credito que le permita comprar lo antes mencionado para tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Daniel, 53, lives in his own house with his parents and his wife.  He works in agriculture growing corn and sorghum.  He plants vegetables and also raises chickens.  With profits earned he’s able to cover some of his household expenses.  He wants to improve his farmland shown in the photo and be able to buy some necessary supplies like manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, etc. for his crops.  However, what he earns is insufficient to cover these expenses and this is why Daniel is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy what was mentioned above so that his profits will increase and he will be able to provide improved economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 49 years old and lives in a small village of the Zugdidi District with her mother and son. Her mother has a retirement pension. Angelina has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a start-up, but without any success because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. The family's sole source of income is growing maize and nut trees. They sell their products locally, but this hardly brings in enough money for food. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.  Angelina has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a new business within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up program emphasizes loans for start-ups and re-startups with easy terms for rural poor people who do not have access to credit. With his loan, Angelina will buy household goods from the wholesalers and then resell them to villagers at a higher price. This will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a business selling household goods.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 29-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is 18 months old. She operates a retail store where she sells handbags, shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in an area with many customer, and her primary customers are locals. 

Sofia will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of handbags, shoes and clothes. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years.

loans.use: to add stock of handbags, shoes and clothes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca nació en la ciudad de Puno pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito del Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú). 

Francisca tiene 47 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Francisca was born in the city of Puno but currently lives in the city of Pilcopata.  (The city of Pilcopata is located in Kosñipata District within Paucartambo Province in Cusco Department, Peru).

Francisca, 47, is in a common law relationship and has four children.  Her main economic activity is lumber sales.  She’s been in this business for several years and she does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She’s an enterprising, hardworking woman who moves her family forward because she’s a member of the “Paititi” communal bank.  

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy lumber.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: Don Raymundo vive en casa propia con su familia vive humildememte en su hogar no poseen los servicios básicos y tienen solamente el acceso de transporte por medio de pick-ups. Se dedica al cultivo de cereales maiz y frijoles y tambien trabaja de jornal cuando la cosecha ha pasado en una finca cerca de su lugar de residencia. Don Raymundo solicita un prestamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y mejoramiento del terreno que muestra en la foto para cultivar 2 manzanas de maíz y así aumentar sus ventas en la temporada para que no le falte el pan diario en su hogar.
texts.en:
Raymundo lives in his own house with his family.  He lives humbly.  His house does not have basic utilities and the only means of transportation is pick-ups.  He works growing corn and beans and also works as a day laborer when harvest time comes to a large estate near where he lives.

Raymundo is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies and to improve his land shown in the photo so that he can cultivate two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of corn in order to increase seasonal sales so that daily bread will not be lacking at home.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to improve his land.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 40 years old. He lives in Chkhorotsku District with his wife and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. Temur requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig, a milking cow, and a calf. Besides that, they have a vineyard and a 1.5 hectare plot of land where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Temur requested a loan from Credo to start-up his family business. Temur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Temur will purchase a car. After purchasing a car, he will begin trade with groceries. He plans to purchase a stock of groceries and transport them with a car to nearby villages to sell at higher price. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and begin trade with groceries

loans.name: Agida

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Aguida to improve her business. She has a vegetable stall where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as vegetables. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Aguida independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and other items

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives outside of Magondi, in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Eunice is married and has three children. Her husband works as a gospel minister, while she tends to their land. She has been farming for six years, and is currently raising cattle. She is happy to work with Honey Care because their Hive Technicians give "dedicated service" to her beehives. Eunice also likes beekeeping because it is a way to control bees, which can be dangerous otherwise. 

This is Eunice's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her beehives to expand the stock in a small retail shop she runs. In the future, Eunice hopes to grow her hives into "a large bee project."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en: Paciencia is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of three who lives in Maribojoc, Bohol. She earns a living by selling fish and has been in this business for more than five years. This is her sole source of her income, and she is requesting a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. This will allow her to increase her sales and profit. Her goal is to expand her business so that it will become a stable source of income for her family and allow her to pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Bayardo Esteban

texts.es: Don Bayardo, es una persona bien reconocida en la comarca donde habita, tiene la edad de 63 años, es casado tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, quienes le ayudan en lo que pueden económicamente a sus padres, don Bayardo trabaja en conjunto con su esposa en la ganadería en donde la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado a esta actividad que es su único medio de ingresos. Solicita este crédito para mejoras de cerca de la finca, por lo que solicita este apoyo de financiamiento para poder salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de su finca.
texts.en:
Bayardo’s a very well-known person in the district he lives in.  He’s 63 years of age, married and has four children who are all independent adults now and who help out their parents economically however they can.

Bayardo and his wife work raising livestock; he’s spent most of his life in this activity that is his only source of income.  He’s asking for this loan in order to make improvements to the farm.  He’s asking for this financial support in order to get ahead and improve the condition of his farm.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire fencing and fence posts.

loans.name: Chongo

texts.en:
Chongo lives outside of Magodi, in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Chongo is married and has six children. His wife works as a businesswoman, and Chongo farms on their land. He has been farming for 40 years and is currently tending an orange orchard on his land, as well as keeping some animals. He is excited to start working with Honey Care because they offer very efficient, regular service. He is also happy to be beekeeping because he is a firm believer in the nutritional benefits of honey. 

This is Chongo's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay for medical treatments. His hope for the future is to improve his animal breeding to get the best livestock.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with one child under his care. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. His major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise his profits.

For that reason, with the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws. He decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Ingrid Compró productos como ropa exterior e interior y los vendió mediante sus guias especializadaso con las que promociónó las mejores ofertas. Ella durante este periodo ha logrado cumplir sus compromisos con su clientela y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella dice a sus financiadores: En primer lugar quiero dar las gracias porque gracias a ellos se ha posido sacar adelante el negocio. " En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva mediante el cual comprará una máquina bordeadora,telas e hilos, ya que trabaja con un  almacen veterinario y le estan soliciando accesorios para las mascotas. como pañoleta, camisetas, pantalonetas que ella misma puede fabricar , vender y generar mas ingresos por este concepto.
texts.en:
Ingrid used her previous Kiva loan to buy products like clothing and underwear that she sold using specialized catalogs that offered the best deals.  During this period of time she’s succeeded in meeting all her customer demands and in improving her quality of life.  She says to lenders: “In the first place, I want to give thanks because thanks to them I’ve been able to move the business forward.”

She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan by means of which she’ll buy an embroidery machine, fabric and thread because she’s working in a veterinary supply and they are asking her for pet accessories like scarves, shirts and shorts that she can make herself to sell and generate income this way.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en: Nunu is 69 years old and lives in the Gurjaani district with husband, son and two grandchildren. She and her husband have a retirement pension. Nunu has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to open a start-up, but without any success because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. Nunu has now requested a loan from Credo to open her start-up. The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo which provides start-up and re-startup credits under easy terms to the rural poor. With his credit, Nunu will begin selling household goods that she buys in Turkey and sells in her neighborhood at a higher price. This will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start selling household goods.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a transport business where she transports customers from one place to another. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be police crackdowns. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy spares for repairing her taxi. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years.

loans.use: to buy spares for repairing her taxi

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en: Rizza is a nipa weaver who lives in the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. Nipa is a type of thatch made from palm leaves that is used in roofing. Rizza is requesting a loan to buy materials to do more weaving, including palm, straw and nylon. This loan will allow her to improve her business and increase her family's income. She also plans to use the additional money she earns to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving nipa, a type of roofing material.

loans.name: Agua Buena Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AGUA BUENA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Matilde ella es casada y tiene 62 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende manzanas, naranjas, plátanos, uvas y mandarinas, la socia lleva las frutas a diferentes lugares como Puerto Maldonado, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas, mandarinas y plátanos.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de pasto.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Agua Buena" ("Good Water") communal bank, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Matilde, 62, is a member of this group. She is married with four children and she works in her own fruit-selling business. She sells apples, oranges, bananas, grapes, and mandarins. She brings the fruit to various places, such as Puerto Maldonado. She has been in this business for eight years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell fruit. She has applied for this loan to buy apples, oranges, mandarins, and bananas.

The member who appears in the inserted photo asked for permission to take her photo later for work-related reasons.

The other members have businesses selling vegetables, selling animals, selling groceries, and selling animal feed.

Matilde is grateful to those who are making up part of her dream, and she is committed to paying her installments at the established times.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, mandarins, and bananas.

loans.name: Magomba

texts.en:
Magomba is a married man with one child. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Magomba runs a vegetable and fruit selling business. His major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise his profits.

For that reason, with the KES 10,000 he wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges. He decided to join Yehu to get financial support and boost his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is engaged in the coconut-buying business for copra making. She is a married woman and a mother of three children from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has been in the business for several years now.

Salome is asking for a loan to buy more coconut for copra-making. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more coconut for copra-making

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is 47 years old from Nyahururu and is married to Samuel, they have seven children, four of which are in school.

She has a green grocery/cereals business, which she has operated for the past 18 years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her purchase cereals, fruit, and green groceries for her business. She paid her previous loan successfully and on time.

She hopes to build her plot in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, green groceries, and fruit.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en: Zeny is 39 years old and has three school-age children. She is now a widow and they live in a rural community. Despite the hardship of living, she has the determination to improve their status to give her children a better living. She engages herself in the hog-raising business to generate additional income. She aims to improve this business in order to increase her income. She is asking for an additional amount of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs. She is hoping that her loan will help her to make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is 53 years old and lives with his wife, two children, and pensioner mother. 

For 20 years, Mahammad has been working as a welder. He provides welding services with his tractor; his activity is a mobile service. With the profit from his welding service, Mahammad meets his family's needs. With the accumulated profit from his service he dreams to buy a new tractor because his tractor is worn.

But today he has applied for the loan to make repair works at his house. The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some urgent repairs. So he is requesting a loan of AZN 1,600 to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, and fiberglass. Using these materials, he will repair his house, thus enabling his family to live in a comfortable and warm place in the winters. Mahammad is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in working capital by buying oil, grease, and auto lubricant.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Phorn is aged 45 years and married. She has six children to take care of. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for 25 years. The current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Phorn with VisionFund. Now she is requesting for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and also to use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old house. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Kofi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped him from achieving his dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Kofi drives a taxi in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has been doing so for about 25 years. He is married to a  farmer, and together they have eight children. Kofi uses all his income to feed and provide for his family. Kofi will use the loan to purchase spare parts for his taxi, which will aid him in improving his overall sales. Kofi wants to use the future profits from his expanded business to ensure that all his children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es:
Achuapa, es un bello y encantador municipio, donde existen diferentes tipos de Actividades que ayudan a la población en empleo. 

Diana María se llama el Joven de 24 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, brinda su servicio como conserje.  

Son de sus sueños mejorar su casa de habitación, por tal razón solicita a Kiva Y Ceprodel que le financie un crédito para la compra de: Cemento, Arena, y ladrillo con esto ayudaría mucho a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Agradece a Kiva y Ceprodel que ayudan con crédito y que siempre piensan en las personas pobres de darle la oportunidad de salir adelante luchando en su vida.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a beautiful and charming town where various activities help the working population.

Diana María, 24, is fighting for her life and that of her family. She offers her services as a janitor.

Her dream is to improve her home, which is why she has applied for a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy cement, sand, and bricks. This would greatly help to improve the living conditions of her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for helping her with this loan and for thinking of poor people, giving them the opportunity to get ahead and fight in their lives.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora iris vive en la cuidad de Managua muy conocida en su vecindario ya que en su casa de habitación tiene un taller de costura  donde confecciona ropa de todo tipo para dama, caballero, niño. 

Doña iris está solicitando un crédito  a kiva para la compra de una máquina para hacer ojal para su negocio.
 
Agradece mucho a ceprodel porque  gracias a los créditos otorgados ha ido aumentando su taller de costura y esto le permite darles empleo a otras mujeres que necesitan llevar el sustento a su hogar para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Iris lives in the city of Managua. She is very well-known in her neighborhood because she has a sewing workshop in her home where she makes all types of clothing for men, women, and children.

Iris is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a machine to make buttonholes for her business.

She is very grateful to Ceprodel because thanks to these loans, she has expanded her sewing workshop. This allows her to offer employment to other women who need to provide for their children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a machine to make buttonholes.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora  vive en Managua Nicaragua, su estado civil es casada, labora en una institución del estado desde hace veintiún año, desempeñándose  como conserje y bajo su cargo a una persona. 
  
El crédito que está solicitando a CEPRODEL es para comprar materiales de construcción como bloque, cemento, para terminar de construir un pequeño cuarto ya que su ingreso no le alcanza para cubrir otros gastos.

Con este  financiamiento que le  otorguen, le será de mucha ayuda. Da gracia adiós y a kiva- ceprodel por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is married and lives in Managua, Nicaragua. She has been working as a janitor in a state-run institution for twenty-one years. She has one dependent.

She has applied for a loan from Ceprodel to buy construction materials, such as blocks and cement, to finish building a small room, since her salary is not sufficient to cover other expenses.

This funding will be of great help to her. She thanks God as well as Kiva and Ceprodel for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Don Roberto de 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa propia, es conocido en la zona como una persona trabajadora y responsable, se dedica al cultivo de maiz y maicillo con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Don Roberto desea cultivar 1.5 manzanas de maiz pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para comprar los insumos necesarios, por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maiz, fertilizantes, abonos, entre otras cosas para poder hacer su siembra y obtener mejores ganancias y seguir dandole a su familia lo necesario sin limtacion alguna.
texts.en:
Roberto, 59, is married and has two children.  He lives in his own house.  He's known in the area as a hardworking and responsible person.

He makes a living growing corn and sorghum.  With his sales he's able to cover some of his household expenses.

Roberto wants to grow 1.5 manzanas of corn but he doesn't earn enough to buy the necessary supplies.  This is why he's requesting a loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer, soil amendments, and other things to be able to do his planting, earn better profits, and continue giving his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and soil amendments

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Doña Ana vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, es conocida en la zona como una persona amable y responsable con sus obligaciones, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y maicillo desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña Ana solicita un credito que le permita poder mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia y comprar los insumos necesarios para su siembra y asi obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden  a solventar los gastos que se le puedan presentar en su hogar y tambien llevarles el pan de cadad dia a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Ana lives in her own home with her husband and children. She is known in the area as a friendly person who is responsible with her obligations. Ana is a farmer who has been growing corn and sorghum for several years. From the sale of her harvested crops, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses.

Doña Ana is requesting a loan so that she can improve the land (as shown in the photograph) on which she plants her crops. She will also buy the necessary supplies for planting. This will enable her to earn more income to help cover the existing household expenses. She will also be able to provide for her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, and other supplies, as well as pay for improvements to her land.

loans.name: Darwins Antonio

texts.es:
Darwins Antonio habita en Managua desde hace seis años, es una persona soltero, tiene un trabajo estable desde hace  nueve años donde se desempeña como agente de seguridad en una universidad privada, es una persona responsable con sus cuatros hijos.

  Darwins Antonio Se presento a la oficina de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como cinc, perlines, para reparar el techo de  su vivienda que está en mal estado y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Darwins Antonio has lived in Managua for six years. He is single, and has had a stable job for nine years working as a security guard at a private university. He is a responsible person with four children.

Darwins Antonio came to the CEPRODEL office to request credit so that he can buy construction materials such as sheet metal and beams to repair the roof of his home, which is in poor condition. Doing this will improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: purchase roofing materials for his home.

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Ana Sofia ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de libros, revistas y periódicos.la socia tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende los libros, revistas y periodicos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de revistas, periódicos y libros. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar revistas, libros y periódicos.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de librería.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES" (Entrepreneurial Friends). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, located in the province and department of Cusco.

One member is Mrs. Ana Sofia. She is single, 48 years old, and has two children. She works at her her own business, a small shop where she sells books, magazines, and newspapers from 8:00am until 7:00pm.  Ana Sofia has eight years of experience in this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her bookstore, and she is requesting this loan so that she can purchase magazines, books, and newspapers.

The other members have a variety of businesses selling beauty products, clothing, groceries, or books.

Ana Sofia thanks everyone who takes part in her dream and promises to make her payments within the established terms.

loans.use: purchase magazines, books, and newspapers for her shop.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel nació en la ciudad de Pilcopata y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito del Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú). 

Angel tiene 58 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de la cuales todos son independientes. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, arena, piedra, calaminas, fierros y también alquila dormitorios. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  materiales de construcción como cemento. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Angel was born in the city of Pilcopata and still lives there. The city of Pilcopata is located in the District of Kosñipata, which is in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

Angel is 58 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children, all of whom are independent. His main business activity is selling construction materials such as cement, sand, stones, corrugated metal, and iron. He also rents out rooms. Angel has been selling construction materials for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts forth in his work.

He is an enterprising and hardworking individual who is a member of the Communal Bank “Paititi”. Angel is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy construction materials, such as cement. He is grateful and values this loan, so he promises to complete the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to sell, such as cement.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
El señor Donald vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como maestro de primaria en un centro educativo que atiende niños en riesgo desde hace 15 años.

Don Donald está solicitando un crédito a kiva  ya que necesita el financiamiento para gastos médicos y pagos de exámenes y compra de medicamento.

A la vez manifiesta su agradecimiento por que con los créditos obtenido a través de kiva ha mejorado considerablemente sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Donald lives in the city of Managua where he works as a teacher. He has been working for 15 years at a school that serves children who are at-risk.

Don Donald is requesting a Kiva loan because he needs financing for his medical expenses, including the payments for examinations and the purchase of medicines. He also expresses his appreciation because the Kiva loans he has obtained have considerably improved his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for his medical expenses.

loans.name: Shirahamwe Group

texts.fr:
Moïse  fait partie du groupe Shirahamwe et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 28 ans et est marié à Françoise, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 3 ans.

Il fait le commerce de   bière et de limonade dans son bar  depuis 1 an et 6mois. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter  le nombre de casiers de bière et de limonade constituant son capital ; ces boissons seront  revendues pour  gagner plus.
texts.en:
Moïse is a member of the Shirahamwe group and he lives in Gitega.  He is 28 years old and married to Françoise, who works in retail.  They have a three-year-old child together.

Moïse has been selling beer and lemonade in his bar for the past 18 months.

He is on his fourth loan with Turame.  With the loan that he is receiving from KIVA, he will increase the number of beer and lemonade crates which constitute his capital.  He will resell these drinks to make more money.

loans.use: to increase his stock of beer and lemonade crates, in order to resell these drinks and make more money.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a wall around her salon and to purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Bumwe Group

texts.fr:
Gaudence  fait partie du groupe  Bumwe et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 45 ans et est mariée à Aloys, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de 6 à  19 ans,  tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre pour  gagner plus.
texts.en:
Gaudence is a member of the Bumwe group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 45 years old and married to Aloys, who works in retail.  Gaudence and Aloys have four children, aged 6 to 19, who all go to school.

Gaudence has been selling bananas for 20 years.

She is on her eleventh loan with Turame.  With the loan that she is receiving from KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to resell and make more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
La señora Olga María vive  en un municipio de cuidad Managua, trabaja  en el área de limpieza en una universidad de Managua, tiene dos pequeños niños en edad escolar.

 Olga está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en su vivienda para darle mayor comodidad a su familia.

 Doña Olga agradece mucho a ceprodel y kiva ya que con  el crédito va a poder concluir el proyecto de mejorar su humilde vivienda.
texts.en: Olga María lives in the city of Managua and works in the cleaning sector at the University of Managua. She has two school-age children. She is requesting the loan to purchase construction supplies to make improvements to her home and give her family more comfort. Olga is very grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva, since with the loan she will be able to finish the improvements on her humble home.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El joven juan Carlos vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como recaudador de impuesto en un mercado de la capital de lunes a viernes y los sábado  se lo dedica a sus estudio universitario ya que su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera universitaria.

Juan es un  persona emprendedora  y con muchos deseos de superación  solicita un crédito para la inversión de compra de materiales de construcción para realizar un anexo en su vivienda primeramente y luego con un poco más de esfuerzo poner un negocio  en su casa para mejorar los ingresos familiares ya que esto le va ayudar a solventar sus estudio y los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives in the city of Managua.  He works as a tax collector in a market in the capital from Monday through Friday, and spends Saturday on his university studies because his biggest dream is to finish his university education.  Juan's an enterprising person with a great desire for self-improvement.

He's requesting a loan to invest in buying construction materials.  First of all he's going to make an addition on his home.  Then, with a little more effort, he'll set up a business in his house to improve his family income because it will help him pay for his studies and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Aura Nohemy

texts.es:
La Joven Aura Nohemy habita en  Managua donde tiene once años de vivir junto a su esposa y  sus tres hijos menores, en edad escolar, es una  persona  trabajadora que se desempeña como conserje en una de la universidades del estado desde hace seis años.
 
Se presento a CEPRODEL con el objetivo de solicitar un crédito para compra de materiales de construcción tales cerámica, boom, ventana y puerta para asegurar su vivienda.

Los sueños de la joven Aura Nohemy es ver su vivienda bien acondicionada y toda con la gracia de dios  y de kiva-ceprodel.
texts.en: Aura Nohemy lives in Managua with her husband of 11 years and their three school-age children. She is a hardworking person who has made a living as a janitor at one of the state universities for six years. She is requesting the loan to purchase construction materials like ceramic tiles, a window and a door to make her home safer. Her dream is to see her  home well equipped, and all thanks to the grace of God and Kiva-CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like ceramic tiles, a window and a door.

loans.name: Barokah Ciracas Group

texts.en:
Ani is a member of the Barokah Ciracas Group. There are three women in the group, and they all live in Susukan, about one hour away from central Jakarta city. Ani lives with her husband and two children. She runs a grocery store out of her home. She wants to borrow a loan to purchase rice and eggs in bulk.  The other members sell prepared food like coconut rice as their businesses.

Ani's husband is a driver and earns about 3,000,000 rupiah a month. This is just enough to meet the family’s needs. A major challenge that Ani is facing now in her business is the weather, and she often feels tired because of her busy schedule. She works from 10:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. at the store and takes care of her children at the same time. In addition, she works as an aerobic instructor on the side to add to the family income. 

Ani hopes as she grows her business, she can hire an employee and purchase inventory in bulk to reduce costs. She hopes to send her children to Islamic school. 

The woman in the middle in the video is Ani.

loans.use: to buy rice and eggs to sell at her grocery store.

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es: Emilce de 31 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de música y de películas diariamente, desde el año 2007, cuando apoyándose en la idea de un amigo, diera inicio a su actividad comercial, con la cual poder apoyar la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge  y sus dos pequeños hijos en las edades de  5 y 6 años. Ella le vende a clientes fijos, que le encargan los CD y a diferentes turistas que encuentra en las playas de la ciudad. Su día de trabajo comienza a las 8 de la mañana y no cesa de hacerlo hasta las 9 de la noche, cuando finaliza. Emilce y su esposo están ahorrando, para comprar su propia casa y aumentar el bienestar de su familia, por eso se esmeran trabajando para alcanzar juntos el sueño de prosperidad con el que beneficiaran a sus hijos. En la actualidad Emilce está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará discos compacto, los cuales  han sido previamente encargados por su clientela y con esta inversión de Kiva,  aumentará el volumen de sus ventas y por consiguiente de sus ingresos.
texts.en: Emilce is 31 years old and has been selling music and movies daily since 2007.  She started doing this when a friend suggested the idea to her and she is able to provide for her family’s wellbeing in this way.  She has two children, ages 5 and 6.  She sells to steady customers who order CDs and to tourists she encounters at the city’s beaches.  Her workday begins at 8:00 am and does not end until 9:00 pm.  Emilce and her husband are saving up to buy a home of their own and improve their family’s wellbeing, so they work enthusiastically to achieve their dream of prosperity together, and so that it will benefit their children.  Emilce is asking for a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy CDs, which she has customer orders for.  This Kiva loan will allow her to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy CDs.

loans.name: Dina Mabel

texts.es: Doña Dina de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues es una mujer trabajadora y amable con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Dina esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar todos los materiales para elaborar las pupusas como: maiz, quesillo, chicharron, frijoles, entre otras cosas para seguir con su negocio y asi pueda seguir dandole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Dina is 48 years old and lives in a home of her own with her two children and husband.  She has been selling tortillas and pupusas for several years.  Her business is located in her home and she has many customers.  She is a very friendly and hardworking woman and uses her earnings to pay the household expenses.  Dina is asking for this loan so she can buy all the supplies she needs to make pupusas; things like dried corn, cheese, pork rinds, beans, and other things so that she can continue with her business and providing her family what they need without limits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Donald José

texts.es:
Don Donald José es originario de Managua, su estado civil es soltero, con dos hijos de estudio todavía, se desempeña como agente de seguridad en una empresa del estado, durante siete años, es una persona con buenos valores morales.

Don Donald José  se presento a esta oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para compra de  bloque, cemento y pago de mano de obra, para  un anexo de un cuarto, ya que uno de sus sueños es llegar a tener una casa con todas las condiciones adecuadas.

 Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva financien su crédito a través de Ceprodel, ya que solo por medio de estos se pueden cumplir los sueños en la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Donald José is from Managua.  He's single and has two children who are still in school.  He has worked as a security guard in a state business for seven years.  He's a person with good moral values.

Donald José appeared in the CEPRODEL office to request a loan to buy cinder blocks and cement and to pay for labor for an addition on a room.  One of his dreams is to have a house with all the suitable features.

He trusts in God that the Kiva lenders will finance his loan through CEPRODEL.  Only this way will he realize these dreams for his family's life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ruben Antonio

texts.es: Don Rubén de 45 añosde edad vive solamente con su esposa ya que sus hijos son independientes, se dedica a la fabricacion de ataudes y muebles, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con la ventas que realiza de su trabajo logra salir adelante con todos los gastos que requiere para vivir diariamente, Don Rube solicita un prestamo para las compra de materia prima como madera, tela, clavos, barnis, pintura de todo tipo de colores, entre otras cosas necesarias para su trabajo ya que ultimamente ha tenido mucha demanda de producción en pedidos y con esas ventas puede obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Rubén is 45 years old and lives alone with his wife, since their children are grown up and independent. He makes a living making caskets and furniture, and he runs his business out of his home. He uses the sales from his work to make headway and cover all the expenses of daily life. Rubén is requesting the loan to purchase supplies like wood, fabric, nails, varnish, all kinds of paint and other necessary items for his job, since lately he has had a lot of demand from production orders and with these sales he will be able to earn more profits to have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase wood, fabric, varnish, paint, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: Jhoselyn tiene 21 años es soltera actualmente cuenta con un negocio propio  que decidió emprender hace 1 año y medio porque tuvo como motivación a su abuela que la aconsejo que invirtiera su dinero que tenia ahorrado. Jhoselyn es socia del grupo “YAHVE YIRE” y cumple la función de secretaria. Su mayor deseo es tener una bodega más grande y con todos los productos en su bodega para satisfacer una de las necesidades primarias de sus clientes. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz. Azúcar, aceite, etc. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Jhoselyn es la primera persona que está parada en el lado derecho y de la misma manera el señor Jose Luis no estuvo en la reunión por motivos de salud.
texts.en: Jhoselyn is 21 years old and single.  She has her own business that she decided to begin one year ago on her grandmother’s prompting, who recommended that she invest the money she had saved up.  Jhoselyn is a member of the YAHVE YIRE group and she serves as the secretary.  Her greatest desire is to have a larger store with all the merchandise she needs to satisfy all of her customers’ needs.  She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Jhoselyn is the first person on the right.  Jose Luis was not at the meeting due to health reasons.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Transito Efraín

texts.es:
Transito tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Él tiene dos años de dedicarse al comercio de chinas, carteras, zapatos, entre otros productos; antes vendía sandia y verduras. Parte de la mercadería la adquiere a dos horas de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar zapatos, carteras, sandalias, chinas y el resto para comprar un producto nuevo ya sea pantalones o camisas. Con la inversión podrá incrementar la cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y tener mayor oportunidad de mejorar sus ganancias. Con las ganancias desea comprar electrodomésticos para su casa ya que no los posee y brindar a sus hijos el estudio para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Transito is 34 years old, married, and has five children.  He has been selling china, wallets, shoes, and other products for two years.  He used to sell watermelon and vegetables.  He buys some of his merchandise two hours away from his home.

He will use the money from this loan through Fundación Campo to buy shoes, wallets, sandals, china, and other things such as pants or shirts.  This will allow him to increase his number of products that he can offer to his customers and have a greater earning opportunity.  He wants to use his earnings to buy appliances for his home, since he doesn’t have any, and provide his children the opportunity to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Delmy Yanet

texts.es: Doña Delmy de 39 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa propia, se dedica al trabajo agropecuario crianza de pollos junto con su esposo, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Doña Delmy esta solicitando un credito para la compra de vitaminas, concentrado y todo lo necesario para seguir con su trabajo de cria de pollos y asi seguir obteniendo mejores ganancias para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en: Delmy is 39 years old and lives with her spouse and 4 children in their own home.  She works in agriculture raising chickens together with her husband.  With the money they earn from their sales, they have succeeded in covering the household costs.  Delmy is asking for this loan to buy vitamins, chicken feed and everything necessary to continue with her work of raising chickens so that she can continue to obtain better income and keep providing the daily bread for her home.

loans.use: buy chicken feed, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Jaider Arley

texts.es:
Jaider de 25 años de edad, es un campesino del  municipio de Sonsón, dedicado desde su infancia a la agricultura por tradición familiar. 
Laboró con su padre por más de 10 años, hasta que tomó la decisión de independizarse. En la actualidad tiene sembrados de arveja, fríjol y aguacate injerto, los cuales comercializa en el mercado local. Con el fin de sacar una cosecha de calidad, se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará insumos agropecuarios y de este modo incrementar su producción.

Su gran sueño es construir una vivienda para su esposa y su hijo de dos años de edad mejorando la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en:
Jaider is 25 years old and is from Sonson.  He decided to become a farmer when he was very young because it was a family tradition.

He worked with his father for more than 10 years until he decided to venture off on his own.  He currently raises peas, beans, and avocados, which he sells in the local market.  He is asking for this loan so that he can have a good harvest and buy farming supplies and increase his production.

His greatest dream is to build a house for his wife and two year old son and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Doña Ana de 47 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijas en casa propia ella se dedica a vender perfumes y cosmeticos de forma ambulante tiene mucha clientela pues los productos que comercializan son de muy buena  calidad, Doña Ana quiere surtir con  mas productos su negocio pero no tiene de capital suficiente para poder realizarlo por eso esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y tener a su clientela satisfecha cuando la busquen para comprarle y asi ella podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidada economica.
texts.en: Ana is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters.  She sells perfumes and cosmetics on foot and has many customers because the products she sells are of good quality.  Ana wants to buy more products but doesn’t have enough money, so she is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise and better satisfy her customers when they come to shop with her.  This way she can increase her income and this will help her obtain better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: Placida, de 47 años de edad . Vive en compañía de su esposo Raúl con quien tiene 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 30 años. Desde su juventud se dedica a elaborar bellos bordados de los trajes artesanales mas usados en su zona, con ayuda de una de sus hijas  y en la comodidad de su casa  trabajan para  combinar los colores de los hilos en cada  diseño de bordado y el buen acabado de su trabajo, también realiza estos bordados para los comerciantes de ropa artesanal que venden en el mercado  local. Con estos años de experiencia tiene mucha destreza en sus manos  y puede avanzar más rápido en menos tiempo, tiene muchas ganas de continuar con su trabajo.Este es el crédito número 2 con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo, así mismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Placida, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de lana y telas para sus bordados.
texts.en: Placida is 47 years old and lives with her husband, Raul.  They have four children whom she cares for in the home she bought 30 years ago.  Since her youth she has been making beautiful embroideries, with the help of one of her daughters, like the ones most worn in her area.  They work together in the comfort of her home to combine the thread colors for each design and do a good job finishing the work.  She also does jobs for clothing merchants in the local market.  These years of experience have given her swift hands and she can advance quickly in less time.  This will be her second loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she will receive in order to continue her work.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Pacida will use the 1,000 PEN to buy yarn and fabric for her embroideries.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
John de 34 años de edad, es ingeniero automotriz y desde hace cinco años decidió montar su propio taller dedicado a prestar el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas. 
Agradece a Dios por la oportunidad que le ha brindado de convertirse en microempresario y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia y la educación de su hijo de 5 años de edad.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la adquisición de una mesa con plataforma para la reparación de las motocicletas, permitiéndole garantizar un trabajo de mejor calidad y mejorando la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
John is 34 years old.  He is an automotive engineer, and five years ago he decided to establish his own workshop dedicated to motorcycle maintenance and repair.  John thanks God for this opportunity that has allowed him to become a microentrepreneur and generate the necessary income to sustain his family and educate his 5 year old child.

Today he is asking for this loan which he will invest in the acquisition of a lift platform for the repair of motorcycles, permitting him to guarantee better quality work and to continue improving the quality of life in his home.

loans.use: to buy a lift platform for the repair of motorcycles

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ligia de 46 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 18 de años. Se ha dedicado al sector de la confección desde su juventud. Debido a que laboró en una empresa de este gremio. Comenzó a trabajar desde su casa como independiente para dedicarle más tiempo a su hijo. 
Su mayor sueño es llegar a ser una empresaria de éxito, expandir su negocio y convertirse en una fuente generadora de empleo. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que espera comprar insumos como telas, hijos, agujas, con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de producción en la fecha de día de madres.
texts.en:
Ligia is 46 years old and the single mother of an 18 year old son.  She decided to begin sewing when she was young because she worked for this type of company.  She began working from her home so that she could dedicate more time to her son.

Her greatest dream is to become a successful entrepreneur and expand her business so she can create employment.

She is asking for a loan so she can buy supplies such as thread, and needles so she can increase her production capacity for mother’s day.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Laura Milena

texts.es: Ropa perfumes, cremas y accesorios femeninos, además de medicamentos naturales, son los productos que Laura ofrece a su mercado objetivo, mediante guías especializadas de productos a través de las cuales los comercializa, todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Ella compra de contado y vende a crédito principalmente, ajustando los plazos a las necesidades de su clientela. Su meta es tener algún día un local comercial, donde exhibirlos y terminar sus estudios, por eso desde el año 2010 emprendió su propia aventura de negocios y hoy a sus 23 años tiene sueños de prosperidad precisos, para genera un mayor bienestar. Laura es una mujer que se esfuerza en su trabajo y responde a sus propios gastos, pero con mucha proyección de futuro, porque el potencial de su mercado es amplio y a todos quiere llegar para ser exitosa. En a actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, accesorios femeninos y medicamentos que le encargaron sus clientes cuando hizo su preventa.
texts.en:
Clothing, perfumes, creams, ladies’ accessories, and natural products are the things that Laura offers through specialized product guides.  She sells every day from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm.  She buys for cash and sells mainly on credit, adjusting the terms according to her customers’ needs.  Her goal is to have her own store where she can show her products and also finish her studies, which she began in 2010.  She began her business adventure at age 23 and she has dreams of prosperity so she can generate a better wellbeing.

Laura is a person who puts a lot of effort into her work and pays her own way, but while looking toward the future because the market potential is great and she wants to be successful.  She is asking for this Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy ladies’ accessories and medications that her customers ordered when she made her presale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luz Marielli

texts.es:
Luz Marielli de 50 años de edad y madre de tres hijos, inició con la venta de productos por catálogo con el fin de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Actualmente pasa por dificultades económicas por lo que requiere de capital con el cual desea adquirir productos de belleza y aseo personal para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar. 
Su mayor deseo es montar su propio almacén de ropa y productos de belleza.
texts.en: Luz Marielli is 50 years old and the mother of three children.  She began selling products by catalog with the aim of generating the necessary income to sustain her family.  Now she is experiencing economic difficulties, and she requires the capital to acquire beauty and personal hygiene products to increase her sales and better the quality of life for her family.  Her greatest desire is to start her own store selling clothing and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Twanzane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Luvao, femme vivant seule sans conjoint, conseillère du collectif de crédit Twanzane, entrepreneur très ambitieuse, qui saisie des opportunités d’affaires. Elle est mère de 6 enfants, qui ont tous leurs diplômes et  qui ont déjà leurs propres foyers. La cliente est âgée de 53 ans. Elle commença son commerce dans sa jeunesse avec son fond propre. Cette cliente n’avait pas étudié faute de moyens. Elle est vendeuse de sacs vide (emballages). Elle se ravitailler en Ouganda/Kampala. Elle a des bonnes relations d’affaires avec les industriels tel que mkono, polisac, oska, polipak, etc., qui les fournissent ces marchandises. Elle a son magasin dans la ville de Goma. La concurrence, le faible capital, constituent des défis pour le développement de son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 ballons de sacs vides auprès l’usine en Ouganda. Dans le futur, elle compte achever son sa maison qui est en chantier de construction. Ainsi, elle bénit le projet de l'IMF Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
The borrower, named Luvao, is a single woman who lives alone.  She is the representative of the Twanzane credit group and a very ambitious entrepreneur, who seizes business opportunities.  She is also the mother of six children who all have degrees and have now established their own families.  

Luvao is 53 years old.  She started her business when she was young, using her own funds.  For lack of means, she never attended school.  She now sells empty shopping bags, buying her supplies in Kampala, Uganda.  She has good business relationships with industrial companies such as Mkono, Polisac, Oska, Polipak etc., which supply her with her merchandise. 

Luvao has a store in the city of Goma. Competition and a small capital are her major challenges for the development of her business.

Luvao will use this new loan to buy four bales of empty bags from a factory in Uganda.  

In the future, she is planning to finish building her house, which is still under construction.  She is extremely grateful for the support that the microfinance institution Hekima provides to small-scale entrepreneurs.
