loans.use: to buy four bales of empty shopping bags from a supplying factory.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Juana Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Juana de 41 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia, ella se dedica a vender empanadas de platanos de forma ambulante en las colonias que estan cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Doña Juana esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar las empanadas como: leche, frijoles, platanos, aceite entre otros ingredientes, para tener mas clientela y ella pueda obtener mejores ganancias y asi poder tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Juana is 41 years old and lives with her husband in a home of her own.  She sells empanadas and plantains on foot, through the neighborhoods close to her home.  With these sales and her husband’s help, she is able to cover the household expenses.  Juana is asking for this loan so she can buy what she needs to make empanadas, such as milk, beans, plantains, cooking oil, and other ingredients, so that she can have more customers and be able to have better earnings and better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to contruct the upper floor of his house

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 22 años de edad es una joven luchadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edwin y su hija.Desde hace 13 años cuando niña, se dedicó al negocio de venta de jugo de caña de azúcar que es medicinal y cura la gripe, es así que le va muy bien en su negocio. Desde las primeras horas del día hasta el atardecer trabaja muy duro con la carretilla que compró hace algunos años y el que le sirve para colocarse en una zona céntrica y comercial. Ahora incorporó a su negocio frutas picadas como piña y sandia. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero de que recibe, de la misma manera se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Carmen, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de caña de azúcar y demás frutas como naranja, piña y sandiílla.
texts.en: Carmen is 22 years old and is a hardworking young woman.  She lives in a home of her own along with her husband, Edwin, and her daughter.  Thirteen years ago, when she was a young girl, she decided to sell sugarcane juice, which is medicinal and good for colds.  Her business is doing well.  She works very hard, from sunrise to sunset, with the cart she bought a few years ago.  She is able to set up in a centrally located commercial area.  Now she also sells diced fruit such as pineapple and watermelon.  This will be her first loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial backing she has gotten.  She also promises to be on time with her payments.  Carmen will use the 1,000 PEN to buy sugarcane and other fruits such as oranges, pineapple, and watermelon.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio Antonio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como recaudador de impuestos de un centro de compra de la capital desde hace 12 años.

 donde trabaja desde las 8 am hasta las 5 de la tarde su mayor esfuerzo lo hace por sacar adelante a su familia , preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente.

Don Silvio está solicitando a kiva un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como bloque arena, cemento para  realizarle mejoras a su vivienda para darle mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Silvio Antonio lives in the city of Managua, where he has been working as a tax collector for 12 years at a shopping center in the capital. He works from 8:00 A.M to 5:00 P.M. Silvio does his best to help his family get ahead and to prepare his children professionally.

Don Silvio is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can invest in the purchase of construction materials such as blocks, sand, and cement in order to make improvements to his home. This will provide greater comfort and security for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for making home improvements.

loans.name: María Gabriela

texts.es:
Mará Gabriela de 65 años de edad, tiene un restaurante, actividad que inició con el fin de  generar sus propios ingresos para el sostenimiento y la educación de su hijo. Por su condición de madre soltera ha tenido que atravesar por muchas dificultades, pero siempre encuentra la forma de salir adelante. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de ollas, cucharones y productos de la canasta familiar, con el fin de renovar los activos de su negocio, incrementar el nivel ventas, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mará Gabriela is 65 years old.  She owns a restaurant, an activity she began for the purpose of generating her own income for the sustenance and education of her son.  As a single mother, she has had to overcome many difficulties, but she always finds a way to come out ahead.  Today she is asking for this loan to invest in ceramic pots, ladles and staple goods, with the aim of renewing the activities of her business, increasing new sales, and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ceramic pots, ladles and staple goods

loans.name: Twanzane-Gs Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kataka, représentante du sous groupe de crédit Twanzane-GS, jeune entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 28 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Son conjoint est un ancien agent d’une entreprise de sécurité « Delta protection », actuellement mise en disponibilité. La cliente est vendeuse des unîtes cellulaires et des articles divers. Elle commença ses activités vers les années 2008 avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia d’un crédit additionnel de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter des unites cellulaires et les articles divers (savons Omo, sucre, lotion de beauté, souliers, Fanta, riz, pétrole, sardine, vêtements, déodorant, etc. La perturbation de réseaux satellitaire constitue un défi pour son activité surtout lors de transfert des unités cellulaires. Cette cliente a aussi été victime d’un vol lors de l’entrée de rebelles du M23 dans la ville de Goma. Au finish, elle felicite Hekima pour son soutien aux petits commerçants.
texts.en:
The borrower, named Kataka, is the representative of the Twanzane-GS credit sub-group.  She is a young, dynamic entrepreneur, aged 28, and the mother of three children.  Her husband used to work for Delta Protection, a surveillance company, but he is now on extended leave.

Kataka sells cellular phone units and other various goods.  She started in this business around 2008 using her own funds received from her husband.  Later on, she also benefited from a loan from Hekima.

This new loan will be used to buy cellular phone units and other various goods (Omo soap, sugar, beauty lotions, shoes, Fanta drink, gasoline, sardines, clothes, deodorant etc.)

Disruptions of satellite systems constitute a challenge for her activity, especially during the transfer of cellular units.  Kataka was also the victim of a theft when members of the M23 rebel group entered the city of Goma.

In the end, she thanks Hekima very much for the support it provides to small-scale retailers.

loans.use: to buy cellular units and other various goods (Omo soaps, sugar, beauty lotion, shoes, Fanta, rice, gasoline, sardines, clothes, deodorant etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola, de 65 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera desde hace muchos años, tiene 2 hijos y vive junto a ellos en su casa propia .El trabajo de Lola consiste en la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras, galletas, gaseosas, leche, pan, huevos , entre otros. Tiene su pequeño negocio instalado en su casa, se dedica a tiempo completo a cumplir esta función y se siente muy contenta por sus ventas. Trabaja sola mientras realiza algunas funciones básicas en su hogar. Abastece su negocio de manera semanal comprando en los centros comerciales del centro de la ciudad con la ayuda de su hijo. Lleva realizando su trabajo desde hace 5 años.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000 soles, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará abarrotes como arroz , azúcar, leche, pan, huevos,entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Lola is 65 years old and is a hardworking woman.  She has been single for many years and has 2 children.  She lives with them in her own house.  

Lola's work is the sale of staple groceries like rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, biscuits, soft drinks, milk, bread and eggs, among other things.  She has her own business inside her house.  She is dedicated full-time to her business, and she feels very happy about her sales.  She runs the business on her own while also handling the basic functioning of her home.  She supplies her business with weekly purchases in the commercial centers downtown in the city with the help of her son.  She has had this business for five years now.  

Lola is asking for a loan of 3000 soles.  She is very happy to know that she has the financial support to continue increasing her working capital, and she promises to make her repayments punctually.  With the loan she will buy groceries like rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs and other products.

loans.use: to buy edible products such as rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Efua is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries to sell, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent operates a bread and meat pie selling business in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). Millicent is a single mother with one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Millicent uses her income to provide for the entire family. Millicent will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of bread and ingredients for meat pies, helping her to improve her overall sales. As a Junior High School graduate, Millicent understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, so she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her child remains in school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and ingredients for meat pies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is single and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Mary is a successful businesswoman. She sells maize in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Mary uses her income to provide for the entire family. Mary will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more maise to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Sarah did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Sarah sells rice in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She   has been doing so for about two years. She is married to a driver and together they have two children. Sarah uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Sarah will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Sarah wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 5 hijos, es conocido en la zona como una persona trabajadora y responsable, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y fríjol tambien trabaja de jornal en una molienda cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con el pago de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Don Santos solicita un credito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, entre otras cosas necesarias para sus cultivos y asi el podra tener mejores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en: 36-year-old Santos lives in his own house with his wife and five children. He is known in the area as a responsible and hard-working person. He makes a living from agriculture. He plants corn and beans. He also works as a day laborer at a mill near his home. With the profits he obtains from his sales and the pay from his work he manages to cover some of his household expenses. Santos is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and other necessary things for his crops so that he will be able to have a better income to contribute to his household.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, fertilizer, etc

loans.name: Edil Alfonso

texts.es: Don Alfonso de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 5 hijos, se dedica a la compra y cría de cerdos para engordarlos y posteriormente comercializarlos, además se dedica también al cultivo de algunos granos básicos que es lo que le posee una entrada adicional de dinero aparte de la de la cría de cerdos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Don Alfonso solicita un credito para la compra de cerdos para negocio tambien vitaminas y concentrado y así poder aumentar el numero de sus ventas para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en: 45-year-old Alfonso lives in his own house with his wife and five children. He makes a living by purchasing and rearing pigs in order to fatten them up and then sell them. He also plants some staple grains as an additional source of money apart from his pig rearing. With the sales he makes he manages to settle some of his household expenses. Alfonso is requesting a loan in order to purchase pigs for his business, as well as vitamins and pellets, so he can increase the number of sales he makes and have a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase pellets, vitamins, and pigs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is still working as a shoe maker and a farmer. After getting financial assistance from KADET LTD, his income has increased and he now earns a monthly income of KES. 10,200. 

He is applying for his second loan to purchase more leather materials to make more shoes for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children

loans.use: to purchase more leather materials

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is involved in selling oranges in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). His earnings are generally used to help his wife (who is a trader) support their four children. He has been involved in selling oranges for seven years now. He plans on using his loan to purchase additional amounts of oranges, thus helping him sell more due to increased inventory capacity. He aspires to use his profits to both better market his orange enterprise and increase his existing working capital. He hopes that this strategy will allow him to expand his present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children, both of whom still attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
She has operated a goat-selling business for the past five years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and becoming a big supplier of goats in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Even though Abena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Abena is an entrepreneur. She sells yam and rice in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. Abena has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more yams and rice to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more yams and rice to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, James is an entrepreneur. He specializes in driving a taxi in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 30 years. James is married and has four children. His wife works as a farmer. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. James will use the loan to purchase spare parts for his taxi, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to further improve his taxi, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Vida did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Vida sells women’s accessories in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a farmer and together they have one child. Vida uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Vida will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of women’s accessories, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Vida wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of women’s accessories

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La Sra. Nilda tiene 22 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 5 años,  ella   se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también frijol, papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Santo Corazon,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Nilda va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de frijol y para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, La Sra. Nilda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida de la cliente y de su familia La Sra. Nilda es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Nilda, 22, is a crop farmer and has a five-year-old son.   She grows a variety of vegetables such as beans, potatoes, yucca plant and corn on her patch of land in the community of Santo Corazon.  This is her first loan through the institution.  Nilda plans to use the loan to prepare the land to plant beans.  The reason for requesting the loan is to have the resources to be able to do the planting and have some left over to live on.

Nilda is up against challenges in her business such as bad weather that on many occasions ruins her crops.  She will use the profits to improve her and her family's quality of life.  She is a responsible, hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support shown her through this loan.

loans.use: To prepare her land for bean planting.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: Doña Maria de 57 años es casada y tiene un hijo, vive en casa propia. actualmente posee 3 molinos de carne los cuales son la fuente principal de sus ingresos tiene ya mas de 2 años de poseer este negocio con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Maria solicita un credito para la compra de repuestos para los molinos como cuchillas, discos, entre otras cosas pues esa es su unica fuente de trabajo y si ella podra darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Maria, 57, is married, has a son and lives in her own home.  She currently has three meat grinders which provide her with her main source of income.  For over two years she has been in business, using her profits to cover household expenses.  

Maria is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for her grinders, such as knives and disc plates, since this is the only work she has to provide for her family without limitation.

loans.use: To buy disc plates and knives for her meat grinders.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr Pedro sigue con la actividad de la venta de comida cuenta que le va muy bien,  el crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su  negocio  y ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes,    creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, el anterior  crédito lo utilizo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida  como abarrotes y Aceite, se siente feliz y agradecido por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Pedro is still in the food business and he says it is going very well.  He will use the loan to buy tables and chairs to expand his business and make his customers more comfortable.  

Since he now has more customers and business has increased, so has his income.  He used the previous loan to buy supplies, such as groceries and oil to make the food.  He is happy and grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Delmin Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Delmin es una mujer de 30 años de edad y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores ya salieron de primaria y le ayudan con las actividades del campo como ser: Corte, Limpieza, Fertilización y abonar sus cultivos, el 3 va a la escuela aun y el ultimo es un menor de 4 años. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo terminar gracias a la ayuda de sus padres; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico ya que ellos eran de escasos recursos económicos. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron el cultivo de café y junto a su esposo lo práctica ase más de 7 años el cual es comercializado y vendido con los compradores que llegan a la zona, vecinos y amistades cercanas. Las tierras que juntos en familia cultivan son propias ya que pudieron obtenerlo por medio de una herencia que sus padres le dejaron el cual está ubicado a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Doña Delmin solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café por medio de los cuales podrá darle una mejor asistencia y mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos para que sus cosechas sean 100% productivas.

Sus metas son de poder ampliar sus cultivos para que esto puedan generar mejores ingresos para su familia y para su hogar de esta forma ella podrá cumplir sus sueños de darles la oportunidad a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando y se puedan graduar de la secundaria y posterior mente de la universidad.
texts.en:
Delmin, 30, has four children, two of whom have finished primary school and help with the farm work, such as cutting, cleaning and fertilizing the crops.  The third child still attends school and the youngest is four years old.  Delmin received a complete first level of primary education thanks to her parents' support but was unable to continue because of a lack of resources.  Her parents taught her how to cultivate coffee and she and her husband have been in the business for over seven years.  She sells to buyers who visit the area, and to neighbors and close friends.  They own their own land which they inherited from her parents and it is two kilometers from their house.  They walk to work every day.

Delmin is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.  She wants to provide adequate crop maintenance so her harvest will be 100% productive.

Her goal is to expand her plantation so she can generate more income for the family and household.  This is so she can fulfill her dream of giving her children the opportunity to continue their education, graduate from high school and then go on to get a university degree.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Vera

texts.es:
Perfil Vera
Chilamate, Poas
500.000



Vera es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, tubo 3 créditos con el Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate, del cual se retiró ya que se dedico a cuidar a su madre, quién ya murió. Después el Banco no la reincorporó por asuntos internos. Ella ha mantenido ventas de comidas principalmente ceviche los fines de semana en su casa y además tiene un vehículo con el que se dedican a realizar servicios de transporte en su comunidad, ya que no cuenta con este servicio, y se deben desplazar cerca de 1 km para tomar el bus, por lo que muchas personas acuden a su familia. El vehículo está varado a causa de un accidente el cual está en un proceso legal. Por lo que solicitan este préstamo para repararlo y ponerlo en funcionamiento mientras se resuelve el asunto legal. 

También ante la difícil situación económica, labora ahora como domestica en una casa en Alajuela, por lo 3 días a la semana debe salir de su casa luego de preparar la comida de su esposo quien también labora en la Ciudad de Alajuela, ambos salen en bus y regresan en la tarde. Terminando las labores domésticas de su hogar.

 La clienta requiere de este préstamo para apoyar a la familia en los ingresos económicos que generaba con la actividad de transporte. Existe el compromiso del esposo y su hijo, con los quien vive, a apoyar a vera en esta actividad

La clienta mantiene una pequeña actividad de subsistencia y la complementa con el trabajo doméstico,  es una familia pobre que el servicio prestado con el vehículo le genera un ingreso importante, por esto se requiere su reparación y para esto acuden a Fundación Mujer y a Kiva para que se les apoye en esta en esta difícil situación.  Cuando Vera  trabajo en el grupo demostró una excelente conducta de pago.
texts.en: Vera lives in Poas, Chilamate, and wants to borrow 500,000 colones. She is a humble, hard-working woman, and she had three loans with a communal bank named 'Mujeres emprendedoras de Chilamate' (meaning 'women entrepreneurs of Chilamate'). She had to leave the bank to care for her mother and, following her death, she was not able to join the bank again for administrative reasons. Vera sells food, mainly ceviche, at her house on week-ends, but her main activity is transportation services in her area, since there is no public transport there, the nearest bus station being one kilometre away. Many neighbours thus come to her for transportation. Her taxi was in an accident, and while she took the persons responsible to court, it is in need of repairs in the meantime. This is why she asks for a loan to repair it while waiting for the legal proceedings to come to an end. In view of her dire financial situation, Vera took another job to compensate for the loss of earnings from her transportation business. She is now a domestic worker in a house in Alajuela: three days a week, she leaves the house after preparing a meal for her husband, who works in the same city, and they take the bus together and come back in the afternoon. Vera then has to do housework in the evenings. She asks for this loan in order to be able to help support her family through her transportation business again. Her husband and her son, with whom she lives, are very supportive of her resuming her transportation activity. Vera's business is very small and she needs to complement it with other sources of income. Since her family is very poor, the income derived from her transportation business is essential to their survival. Repairs are therefore urgent. Vera turns to field partner Fundación Mujer and to Kiva lenders for support through these difficult times. When Vera was a member of the communal bank, she was always on time for repayments.

loans.use: to repair her taxi.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María cristina vive en una comarca situada en la parte sur de la capital es casada con dos pequeños hijos a su cargo los cuales están en edad escolar.

Se desempeña como secretaria en un centro de estudios universitario de la capital desde hace dos años.

Doña María solicita un financiamiento a kiva y ceprodel  para hacer la inversión de  compra de zinc y perlines para el cambio de techo de su vivienda ya que considera necesario para  hacer ese cambio antes que entre el invierno para que no se le pase el agua a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Cristina lives in the southern area of the capital.  She is married and has two small children who attend school.  She has worked as a secretary at a university in the capital for two years.

María is requesting a loan through Kiva and Ceprodel to buy zinc sheeting and profiles to change the roof on her house.  She feels this is necessary to do before winter arrives so water does not filter into the house.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and profiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is an entrepreneur, although she has received no prior formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a blacksmith. 

Efua prepares and sells ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves) and can be found selling it in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 12 years. The proceeds from her ‘Wakye’ business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice and beans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans, helping her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a 59-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown-up children. Claudia lives with her family in Sikatuna, Bohol. She is engaged in food vending and clothing and cosmetics sales. This is the source of her income. Claudia is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, baking soda and oil and additional cosmetics and clothing for her clothing sales. Through this, she will be able to sell more and increase her sales and profit. In the future, Claudia hopes to make her business a success and profitable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, baking soda and oil and additional cosmetics and clothing for her clothing sales

loans.name: Richar Yefri

texts.es: Richar de 33 años de edad se dedica a la agriculrura siembra frijoles y maíz, el vive junto a su esposa e hijos, y se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien trabaja muy duro por salir adelante tambien trabaja de albañil, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y el pago por su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar.  él solicita un credito por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de semilla de maíz y frijoles para sembrar, así mismo desea comprar unos depósitos para colocar la cosecha y de esta forma mantenerla siempre fresca, y asi asegurarse de brindar siempre la mejor a su familia sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Richar is 33 years old and makes a living in the cultivation of bean and corn. He lives with his wife and children and stands out for being a very responsible and hard-working person, who works very hard to get ahead. He also works as a bricklayer, and with the income from his sales and the payment for his work he covers some of his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan so he can have the money to invest in the purchase of a bigger quantity of corn and bean seed to plan. He would also like to buy tanks to store the harvest, for it to remain fresh. This way he can make sure that he always provides the best for his family, without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn and bean.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling beans and maize near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years.

Efua is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying for their children’s school fees.

Efua will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of beans and maize to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of beans and maize

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is single and has one child. After successfully graduating Junior High School, Paulina is now an established businesswoman. She sells beans and plantains in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about seven months. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Paulina uses her income to provide for her family. Paulina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of beans and plantains, thus helping her improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Paulina plans to diversify the type of products that she sells to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase beans and plantains

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Doña Maria de 63 años de edad es una persona responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo amable ella se dedica a  comercializar todo tipo de ropa de forma ambulante en los lugares que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su familia, Doña Maria esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda de clientes por vender a buen precio sus mercaderias y asi pueda obtener mejores ingresos economicos para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 63 years old. She is a responsible, hardworking and above all kind woman. She sells all types of clothing as a street vendor in places close to her home. She lives in her own home with her family. Maria is asking for a loan that will allow her to be able to buy more merchandise to stock her business, since their is a lot of demand from customers. She can sell her merchandise at a good price and thus obtain better income and have a better life with her mother.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo José vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona responsable que lucha por el bienestar y el futuro de su familia, es casado, tiene tres persona a su cargo y labora en una universidad del estado desde hace tres años desempeñándose como agente de seguridad.
  
Esta solicitando crédito a CEPRODEL para poder hacer un anexo de un cuarto para ampliar la sala de su casa y este crédito lo utilizara en compra de bloque, cemento, y pago de mano de obra.

Con este financiamiento lo invertirá en mejorar su vivienda y agradece a kiva a través de Ceprodel por el apoyo que le puedan brindar, porque solo así a podido ir  acondicionando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo José lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He is a responsible person who fights for the well being and future of his family. He is married and has three dependents. He has worked at a state university for three years as a security guard.
  
He is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL to be able to build an annex on a room to expand the living room of his house. He will use this loan to buy blocks and cement and to pay for labor costs. 

With this loan, he will invest in doing home improvements. He is grateful to Kiva through Ceprodel for the support they can offer him, because this is the only way he has been able to remodel his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nin's Group

texts.en:
Nin, 52, is a married mother of four children. She lives in a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. 

The source of her family’s income is rice farming on one hectare of farmland. She and her husband have been in this business for 30 years. 

This is the first loan for Nin with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Nin wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She operates a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of obtaining a license for the business and also transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business to wholesale in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 30 bags of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa, 37, is a husband and a father of four children. He is a native of Kambia town in northern Sierra Leone. His wife is a businesswoman. Three of his children are attending primary school and the other is not of school-going age. 

Issa works at a sugar-producing company in Sierra Leone. He has been on the staff at this company for 10 years now. In addition to his work at the company, Issa is also a businessman who sells used clothes and gara lappers (locally dyed cloths). He has been a businessman for five years now. 

He has requested this loan in order to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
For years, Mjeni has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, operating a door-to-door service whereby town dwellers and neighbors are her potential clients. She mentioned that during the rainy season, it becomes hard to operate her business, hence a low income is then earned.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle for the transport business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 23 years old. He lives in the small village of Khulo District with his parents and brother. Lasha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have calves and a plot of agricultural land, where potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested potatoes locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lasha requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Lasha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Lasha will purchase phone accessories. He has rented a commercial space, where he plans to sell phone accessories. He will work there and also offer to repair his clients' damaged phones. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to resell.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en: Eutropia earns a living through her sari-sari (or variety store) business, selling various goods to the people in her place in Bohol, Philippines. She needs a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store, like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap, toiletries and other items. She believes that if she will be granted a loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store, like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 35 años de edad joven, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse. Ella está en una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una familia muy numerosa compuesta por 6 hijos de los cuales los tres mayores están estudiando a nivel primario, 2 no estudian y un recién nacido. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación no pudo estudiar ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña y tiene 5 años de dedicarse junto a su pareja esta actividad. El terreno que ella junto a su pareja cultivan es propio ya que fue una herencia de parte de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 70 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Hoy en día Ana solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café por medio del cual podrá obtener una cosecha sana y la podrá aprovechar al 100%.

Sus sueños son los de ver a sus hijos culminados a nivel universitario, que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y las ganancias son pocas.
texts.en:
María  is a 35 year old woman. She is young, a fighter, enterprising and really wants to get ahead. She is in a common law marriage and has a big family with six children. The three oldest are in primary school. 2 aren't in school and one is a newborn. She doesn't have any education and was unable to go to school because her parents were of low income. They were the ones who taught her to work the land since she was very small. For 5 years, she has worked with her spouse at this activity. They land she plants with her spouse is their own since it was inherited from one of her parents. It is located 70 meters from her house and they walk there every day.

Today Ana is asking for help to buy manure and fertilizer for her coffee crops so she can have a healthy crop that she can benefit from 100%. 

Her dreams are to see her children finish college and have better opportunities in life and in work. Working the land is very difficult and the profits are low.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel is a 35-year-old micro-entrepreneur. She lives with her husband, Lhamragchaa, and four sons between 1 and 16 years old in a ger (traditional yurt) in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. 

She had been living in countryside for years, breeding livestock and producing organic dairy products until 2012. She needed to move to the province center in order to send her children to schools. She and her husband are concerned about their sons' educations and plan to send all of them to universities for whichever studies their children want too pursue. 

She has just started her clothes retail business in the local market and needs some financial support. So she is now requesting loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her new clothes retail business. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and smart lady.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new clothes retail business.
